</div>
      <span rel="schema:author" class="field field--name-uid field--type-entity-reference field--label-hidden"><a title="View user profile." href="https://cms.zerohedge.com/users/tyler-durden" lang="" about="https://cms.zerohedge.com/users/tyler-durden" typeof="schema:Person" property="schema:name" datatype="" class="username" xml:lang="">Tyler Durden</a></span>
<span property="schema:dateCreated" content="2025-05-22T22:05:00+00:00" class="field field--name-created field--type-created field--label-hidden">Thu, 05/22/2025 - 18:05</span>


Title: Watch: Harmeet Dhillon Exposes DOJ's 'Color Revolution' Wing: Secret 'Resistance' Memos, 'Unhappy Hours,' & 'Crying Sessions'
Description: <span property="schema:name" class="field field--name-title field--type-string field--label-hidden">Watch: Harmeet Dhillon Exposes DOJ's 'Color Revolution' Wing: Secret 'Resistance' Memos, 'Unhappy Hours,' & 'Crying Sessions'</span>

            <div property="schema:text" class="clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item"><p>In a revealing interview with Tucker Carlson,<strong> Harmeet Dhillon, Assistant Attorney General for the Civil Rights Division, pulled back the curtain on the entrenched resistance within the Department of Justice</strong>, which she described as a stronghold of the deep state. <strong>Dhillon revealed a culture of anti-MAGA defiance</strong>, marked by resistance memos circulating among career lawyers, instructing them to obstruct directives through bureaucratic tactics.¬†Dhillon also¬†recounted a hilarious scene of <strong>open crying sessions in the DOJ halls</strong> and mass resignations as hundreds of attorneys recoiled at her push to align the division with the Trump administration‚Äôs agenda.</p>

<p><iframe allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" referrerpolicy="strict-origin-when-cross-origin" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/RFbAQKMZnb4?si=JdiE3A6QbFWONECb&start=264" title="YouTube video player" width="560"></iframe></p>

<p>TUCKER CARLSON:¬†Your assistant attorney general, one of the greatest appointments, from my perspective, in this administration, running the civil rights division. What was it like when you showed up? What did you find when you got there?</p>

<p>HARMEET DHILLON:¬†<strong>The civil rights division is the color revolution wing of the Department of Justice</strong>. Okay, whether it's a Republican or a Democrat administration, there are career lawyers who are very focused on a particular agenda there. <strong>So, when I showed up, or when I was, when the president was elected, I should say, there were over 400 attorneys in the civil rights division and about 200 staff, so a total of about 600 people.</strong> Kristen Clark, my predecessor, anti-police, open racist, got in trouble during her term for not being candid with the Senate during her confirmation hearings on some issues. So, she had a particular agenda. She got in there and she pursued that agenda aggressively. And she had all the staff to do it.</p>

<p><strong>Now, under the first Trump administration, my predecessor in that job pretty much left it untouched. </strong>He told me he kind of, like, there were the career people there, if he wanted to get something done, they went to the U.S. attorney's offices. I came in with a different perspective. I think it's part of the promise of this administration under President Trump to fundamentally reform the government in the way that the people voted for. That means, in the civil rights division, we should be standing up for the civil rights of all Americans, not just some Americans. We shouldn't be weaponizing the law in a particular way. We should apply those federal civil rights statutes, many of which were passed by and signed by Republican presidents and Republican administrations, evenly, and the government shouldn't be putting its heavy thumb on the scale in most cases. But in egregious instances, we should step forward and right these wrongs.</p>

<p><strong>But what I found there was a number of lawyers, I mean hundreds of lawyers, who were actively in resistance mode.</strong> There were memos out there by former government lawyers telling current government lawyers in my department how to resist if you're given a direct order. Ask for clarification, send 20 emails, question it, slow down your response time, say it can't be done. So, I was actually looking out for that when I came. I did my week of training after getting confirmed by the Senate. And then the next week, I was like, "Okay, guys, it's time to get to business. I want everyone to be very clear what the agenda is here.‚Äù</p>

<p>So, there are 11 sections in civil rights, and I drafted memos for each of those 11 sections for the lawyers, telling them, these are the statutes. So, for example, Americans with Disabilities Act, this is the statute that we enforce, or Title 7 anti-discrimination, or some of the other federal civil rights statutes. And then that's the baseline. And then this is the president's agenda. These are his executive orders that he's put out there about anti-discrimination, about anti-DEI, about enforcing our laws equally. And that's the job. You are going to apply these statutes within the framework of anti-discrimination, even-handedly and without fear or favor.¬†And this catalyzed hundreds of lawyers to quit the civil rights division.</p>

<p>TUCKER CARLSON: <strong>So, wait, they quit because you informed them of the law?¬†</strong></p>

<p>HARMEET DHILLON:¬†Yes. And the law and the priorities, their pet projects had changed.¬†</p>

<p>TUCKER CARLSON:¬†They weren't going to be able to do those the way that they wanted. And so, they thought that this part of the Department of Justice was just immune to democracy.</p>

<p>HARMEET DHILLON:¬†It has been, I mean, there were career lawyers there who were doing the same thing no matter who's a president. <strong>And so, suddenly, their little fiefdom that had remained untouched, like Shangri-La, was suddenly having to be responsive to elections.¬†</strong></p>

<p>TUCKER CARLSON:¬†That's the definition of the deep state, what you just described. Elections have no effect. It's like there's no way to control these people. They act totally independently from the democratic system. I mean, that's the problem right there.</p>

<p>HARMEET DHILLO<strong>N:¬†Well, that's what I found. And so, in response to my memos, of course, </strong>they began leaking to the press. They began having unhappy hours, which they would invite supervisors, political supervisors, to, to make their point that they were unhappy. We got the point. And they had crying sessions, struggle sessions, crying sessions in the DOJ.¬†</p>

<p>TUCKER CARLSON:¬†They cried?¬†</p>

<p>HARMEET DHILLON:¬†Oh, t<strong>here was open crying in the halls. Crying, crying, crying. Yes.</strong> And then one of my colleagues described to me, it was the last day a couple of weeks ago for some of them. They lined up in a phalanx and approached the elevator together, and then they left the building together, to show their solidarity for one another there, as if they were high school students or adults.These are 30, 40, and 50-year-old career attorneys in the Department of Justice.¬†</p>

<p>HARMEET DHILLON: It's pathetic.</p>
</div>
      <span rel="schema:author" class="field field--name-uid field--type-entity-reference field--label-hidden"><a title="View user profile." href="https://cms.zerohedge.com/users/tyler-durden" lang="" about="https://cms.zerohedge.com/users/tyler-durden" typeof="schema:Person" property="schema:name" datatype="" class="username" xml:lang="">Tyler Durden</a></span>
<span property="schema:dateCreated" content="2025-05-22T21:40:00+00:00" class="field field--name-created field--type-created field--label-hidden">Thu, 05/22/2025 - 17:40</span>


Title: Senators Question Spending Cuts In Key Nuclear, Science Programs
Description: <span property="schema:name" class="field field--name-title field--type-string field--label-hidden">Senators Question Spending Cuts In Key Nuclear, Science Programs</span>

            <div property="schema:text" class="clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item"><p><em><a href="https://www.theepochtimes.com/us/senators-question-spending-cuts-in-key-nuclear-science-programs-5861389">Authored by John Haughey via The Epoch Times</a> (emphasis ours),</em></p>

<p>A day after the Tennessee Valley Authority <a href="https://www.tva.com/news-media/releases/tva-submits-nation-s-first-construction-permit-application-for-bwrx-300-smr">announced</a> it had filed a permit to install the nation‚Äôs first small modular nuclear reactor, <strong>Secretary of Energy Chris Wright said the breakthrough marks the dawn of a new era in commercial electrical power and that sustaining momentum in advanced nuclear generation is the nation‚Äôs ‚Äúnext Manhattan Project.‚Äù</strong></p>
<a data-image-external-href="" data-image-href="/s3/files/inline-images/image_92%2883%29_0.jpg?itok=PjOLXxjn" data-link-option="0" href="https://cms.zerohedge.com/s3/files/inline-images/image_92%2883%29_0.jpg?itok=PjOLXxjn"><picture><figure role="group" class="caption caption-img inline-images image-style-inline-images"><img alt="" data-entity-type="file" data-entity-uuid="a1f460da-2dce-4a7b-979b-656db69a516a" data-responsive-image-style="inline_images" height="281" src="https://assets.zerohedge.com/s3fs-public/styles/inline_image_mobile/public/inline-images/image_92%2883%29_0.jpg?itok=PjOLXxjn" typeof="foaf:Image" width="500" /><figcaption><em>Test engineer Jacob Wilcox pulls his arm out of a glove box used for processing sodium at TerraPower, a company developing and building small nuclear reactors in Everett, Wash., on Jan. 13, 2022. AP Photo/Elaine Thompson, File</em></figcaption></figure></picture></a>

<p>‚Äú<strong>America must lead the commercialization of affordable and abundant nuclear energy</strong>,‚Äù he told the Senate Appropriations Committee‚Äôs Energy and Water Development Subcommittee. The Department of Energy ‚Äúis working to advance the rapid deployment of next generation nuclear technology, including small modular reactors.‚Äù</p>

<p>Eventually, perhaps within a decade, small nuclear modular nuclear reactors, or<strong> SMRs, will be mass-produced,</strong> be portable, and ideal for ‚Äúharnessing our energy potential to power global AI leadership while meeting growing energy demand,‚Äù Wright <a href="https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/secretary_wright_testimony.pdf">testified</a>, calling commercial deployment of such ‚Äúnext-generation technology ‚Ä¶ the challenge of our time.‚Äù</p>

<p>If so, Democrats and several Republicans wondered during a two-hour <a href="https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/hearings/a-review-of-the-presidents-fiscal-year-2026-budget-request-for-the-department-of-energy">May 21 hearing</a>, why is the Trump administration seeking to cut budgets for the department‚Äôs Office of Nuclear Energy by nearly 47 percent and its Office of Science by 87 percent in its <a href="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/Fiscal-Year-2026-Discretionary-Budget-Request.pdf">Fiscal Year ( FY) 2026 spending request</a>?</p>

<p>‚Äú<strong>On one hand, you and the president say you support U.S. dominance in energy, emerging technologies</strong>,‚Äù Sen. Patty Murray (D-Wash.) said, ‚Äúbut then, on the other hand, you are proposing cutting over $1 billion dollars in funding to the Office of Science‚Äù and $408 million from the Office of Nuclear Energy.</p>

<p>She said the still-vague spending request, a broad outline crafted by the White House‚Äôs Office of Management and Budget and not by the department itself, is counterintuitive to the Trump administration‚Äôs pledge to ‚Äúwin the AI race against China.‚Äù</p>

<p>The previous FY25 Department of Energy budget earmarked $8.6 billion for the Office of Science and nearly $770 million for the Office of Nuclear Energy, key allocations that leverage federal seed money to induce private investment in financing demonstrations of emerging technologies.</p>

<p>The stark slashes in such funding ‚Äúreally undermines critical research programs for AI, for fusion, for quantum computing, for nuclear energy, and critical minerals,‚Äù Murray said. ‚Äú<strong>How are investors and companies supposed to have confidence in partnering with you when what you say and what your budget says are two different things?‚Äù</strong></p>

<p>Sen. Katie Britt (R-Ala.) asked Wright for assurances that the budget will include funding for SMR development and research into other emerging reactor technologies underway in her state, and Sen. Bill Hagerty (R-Tenn.) stressed how important federal support for commercial nuclear power is for his state and for the nation.</p>

<p>‚ÄúThe United States is at a pivotal moment in energy production. It‚Äôs not just for our nation, it‚Äôs for the entire world,‚Äù Hagerty said. ‚Äú<strong>Tennessee has been at the forefront of what you‚Äôve called yourself ‚Äòthe Manhattan Project 2.0.‚Äô‚Äù</strong></p>

<p>SMRs and emerging nuclear technologies were among an array of topics discussed during the Senate‚Äôs first hearing on the Department of Energy‚Äôs proposed <a href="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/Fiscal-Year-2026-Discretionary-Budget-Request.pdf">$45.1 billion budget</a>, which cuts $19.3 billion in funding for Biden Era ‚Äúgreen energy‚Äù initiatives, including slashing three-quarters of approved allocations for energy efficiency and renewable energy programs, which didn‚Äôt include nuclear power options.</p>

<p>The tentative request is 9.4 percent less than FY25‚Äôs $52 billion department budget. Beyond a 25-percent increase in funding for the National Nuclear Security Administration, which manages the nation‚Äôs nuclear weapons programs, it trims spending by 18.2 percent, cutting $15.2 billion in allocations from the 2021 Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and $2.6 billion from the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy.</p>

<p>The ‚Äúgreen energy‚Äù cuts were telegraphed by President Donald Trump during his campaign and in his executive orders but the massive rollbacks in energy innovation investments are surprising, Murray said.</p>

<p>‚Äú<strong>It feels like you want to gift-wrap the future and hand it to China</strong>,‚Äù she told Wright.</p>
<a data-image-external-href="" data-image-href="/s3/files/inline-images/image_92%2882%29_0.jpg?itok=-gPYPJmg" data-link-option="0" href="https://cms.zerohedge.com/s3/files/inline-images/image_92%2882%29_0.jpg?itok=-gPYPJmg"><picture><figure role="group" class="caption caption-img inline-images image-style-inline-images"><img alt="" data-entity-type="file" data-entity-uuid="a5042f4e-a76f-4a8f-a86a-6a2aef84af48" data-responsive-image-style="inline_images" height="333" src="https://assets.zerohedge.com/s3fs-public/styles/inline_image_mobile/public/inline-images/image_92%2882%29_0.jpg?itok=-gPYPJmg" typeof="foaf:Image" width="500" /><figcaption><em>Sen. Patty Murray (D-Wash.) speaks during the weekly Senate presser in the U.S. Capitol building in Washington on July 9, 2024. Madalina Vasiliu/The Epoch Times</em></figcaption></figure></picture></a>

<h2>More Money Coming</h2>

<p>Wright assured senators that the administration will not cripple research and development of SMRs and other emerging technologies by pulling money from ongoing demonstration programs.</p>

<p>He said his department is reshuffling allocations from Biden era ‚Äúintermittent‚Äù energy programs, such as solar and wind, and reorganizing its offices and staffing to be more focused on advancing technologies that will triple the nation‚Äôs electrical capacity in the coming decades.</p>

<p>Wright acknowledged the department has not yet finalized its formal spending request, cautioning that in its tentative state, ‚ÄúEach individual line item does not indicate a policy.‚Äù</p>

<p>‚Äú<strong>The nuclear industry is quite enthusiastic and quite confident they‚Äôre going to have the best environment ever for commercial nuclear power under this administration</strong>,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWhat we‚Äôre doing is mobilizing tens of billions of dollars of private capital using the government‚Äù allocations to anchor those investments.</p>

<p>Wright said the department has offered land near or at its 16 national labs. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had tons of solicitations to come build on our land,‚Äù he said.</p>

<p>Britt said that <a href="https://www.theepochtimes.com/opinion/us-china-nuclear-fusion-race-the-battle-for-energy-and-military-dominance-5828992">communist China</a> has ‚Äúat least 28 nuclear reactors that are in construction, which is about half of the construction of all nuclear reactors across the entire globe,‚Äù so time is of the essence.</p>

<p>Wright said that deregulation and permitting reform are top priorities in ensuring that the United States will meet that challenge.</p>

<p>‚ÄúChina is moving full speed ahead with nuclear. In fact, the most reactors they‚Äôre building [are], essentially, a knockoff, a stealing of American reactor technology,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBut they build them much cheaper and much faster, and they don‚Äôt have the giant bureaucratic regulatory overhang we have in the United States.‚Äù</p>
<a data-image-external-href="" data-image-href="/s3/files/inline-images/image_92%2883%29_1.jpg?itok=3LT6xyMN" data-link-option="0" href="https://cms.zerohedge.com/s3/files/inline-images/image_92%2883%29_1.jpg?itok=3LT6xyMN"><picture><figure role="group" class="caption caption-img inline-images image-style-inline-images"><img alt="" data-entity-type="file" data-entity-uuid="6fb0cf85-cfba-4d8d-84ed-a51c2f2f2ba4" data-responsive-image-style="inline_images" height="281" src="https://assets.zerohedge.com/s3fs-public/styles/inline_image_mobile/public/inline-images/image_92%2883%29_1.jpg?itok=3LT6xyMN" typeof="foaf:Image" width="500" /><figcaption><em>Artist rendition of NuScale Power‚Äôs small modular nuclear reactor plant. NuScale</em></figcaption></figure></picture></a>

<p>Under current regulations, Wright said, New York‚Äôs Grand Central Station ‚Äúcould not be licensed as a nuclear reactor because its radiation is too high.‚Äù</p>

<p>The department‚Äôs pitch to commercial providers is, ‚ÄúWe‚Äòll be fast, we‚Äôll be efficient. We‚Äòll help you get going. We‚Äôll arrange creative incentives for you to build nuclear reactors in our space. I think we'll do it.‚Äù</p>

<p>Hagerty asked how the department can be play ‚Äúa central role in advancing and achieving American energy dominance and grid liability‚Äù by advancing SMRs at commercial scale.</p>

<p>Wright said it is prudent to be careful when investing in ‚Äúfirst-mover‚Äù prototypes to ensure that taxpayer money is wisely spent on systems that will work.</p>

<p><strong>‚ÄúI am all-in with you on advancing nuclear</strong>,‚Äù he told Hagerty, and offered an analogy to illustrate why patience is needed while the department restructures loan programs away from renewables to nuclear and other baseload generation.</p>

<p>‚ÄúImagine if the Department of Defense sent out a quote to the defense companies, and said, ‚ÄòWe want to buy tanks. We'll pay full price for high-performance tanks, but you can deliver a tank that only moves some of the time, maybe when the sun‚Äôs shining, and will shoot, maybe, when the wind‚Äôs blowing,‚Äô‚Äù Wright said of intermittent power generators.</p>

<p>The Biden administration was paying full price for ‚Äúan underperforming tank‚Äù while providing subsidies to the factories to build them, he said.</p>

<p>‚ÄúSo what do you think is going to happen?‚Äù Wright asked. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to get paid to deliver an inferior tank and a subsidy. Of course, you‚Äôre going to do it.</p>

<p>‚ÄúAnd then what happens to your army? It‚Äôs not just the poor kids that are in those tanks, it‚Äôs the kids that are in all the other tanks that now have underperforming partners in the battle that are at risk.‚Äù</p>
</div>
      <span rel="schema:author" class="field field--name-uid field--type-entity-reference field--label-hidden"><a title="View user profile." href="https://cms.zerohedge.com/users/tyler-durden" lang="" about="https://cms.zerohedge.com/users/tyler-durden" typeof="schema:Person" property="schema:name" datatype="" class="username" xml:lang="">Tyler Durden</a></span>
<span property="schema:dateCreated" content="2025-05-22T21:15:00+00:00" class="field field--name-created field--type-created field--label-hidden">Thu, 05/22/2025 - 17:15</span>


Title: Iran Will Hold US Responsible For Any Israeli Attack On Nuclear Sites: Foreign Minister
Description: <span property="schema:name" class="field field--name-title field--type-string field--label-hidden">Iran Will Hold US Responsible For Any Israeli Attack On Nuclear Sites: Foreign Minister</span>

            <div property="schema:text" class="clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item"><p>Earlier this week CNN had issued an alarming report claiming that Israel is currently <a href="https://www.zerohedge.com/geopolitical/israel-subject-unprecedented-pressured-allies-over-gaza-escalation">preparing possible preemptive strikes</a> on Iranian nuclear facilities. It underscored that at this¬†moment it has become very clear that Netanyahu could care less about 'pressure' from Western allies the US, UK, and Canada regarding the Gaza crisis. Israel continues to essentially be at war on multiple fronts.</p>

<p>Parallel to all of this, Washington and Iran have been engaged in productive talks on potentially reaching a fresh nuclear deal - which the Netanyahu fundamentally sees as but an Iranian ploy to buy time as it secretly develops nukes (in Tel Aviv's thinking). <strong>But Iran's leaders are calling for the United States to essentially 'keep its dog on a leash' - as Israel wishes to torpedo a deal</strong>.</p>

<p>In fresh statements, Iran now says it <strong>will hold the United States responsible</strong> in the event of an unprovoked Israeli attack on its nuclear energy sites. Certainly any such attacks would completely derail efforts to reset relations with Washington.</p>
<a data-image-external-href="" data-image-href="/s3/files/inline-images/iranfmfile.jpg?itok=G0s5AILY" data-link-option="0" href="https://cms.zerohedge.com/s3/files/inline-images/iranfmfile.jpg?itok=G0s5AILY"><picture><figure role="group" class="caption caption-img inline-images image-style-inline-images"><img alt="" data-entity-type="file" data-entity-uuid="d4b43976-25bd-46d4-a289-a2ecc5b864e4" data-responsive-image-style="inline_images" height="333" src="https://assets.zerohedge.com/s3fs-public/styles/inline_image_mobile/public/inline-images/iranfmfile.jpg?itok=G0s5AILY" typeof="foaf:Image" width="500" /><figcaption><em>via AP/Getty Images</em></figcaption></figure></picture></a>

<p>"Iran strongly warns against any adventurism by the Zionist regime of Israel and will decisively respond to any threat or unlawful act by this regime," Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi stated in a letter addressed to United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres.</p>

<p>"I have called on the international community to take effective preventive measures against the continuation of Israeli threats, which if unchecked, <strong>will compel Iran to take special measures in defense of our nuclear facilities and materials</strong>," Araghchi said.</p>

<p>And as cited in <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/irans-revolutionary-guards-warn-israel-against-any-attack-2025-05-22/"><em>Reuters</em></a>:</p>

<blockquote>
<p><em>Araqchi said <strong>Iran would view Washington as a ‚Äúparticipant‚Äù in any such attack</strong>, and Tehran would have to adopt ‚Äúspecial measures‚Äù to protect its nuclear sites and material if threats continued, and the watchdog International Atomic Energy Agency would be subsequently informed of such steps.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<p>"The nature, content, and extent of our actions will correspond and be proportionate to preventive measures taken by these international bodies in accordance with their statutory duties and obligations," the Iranian top diplomat added.</p>

<p>Washington and Tehran are gearing up for a<strong> fifth round of nuclear talks to be held in Rome this Friday</strong>.</p>

<p>Lately the Ayatollah has weighed in following reports that Iran is ready to halt enrichment altogether and in return get sanctions lifted. Ali Khamenei had called the latest US demands that Iranian enrichment be taken down to zero¬†<strong>"excessive and outrageous,"</strong>¬†<a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/iran-reviewing-proposal-5th-round-nuclear-talks-2025-05-20/">according</a>¬†to state media on Tuesday. He further expressed doubts that current nuclear talks with the Trump administration will actually lead anywhere.</p>

<p>Meanwhile in Tehran, the parliament has "reaffirmed the peaceful nature of Iran‚Äôs nuclear program, <strong>saying that the Islamic Republic has never sought, nor will it seek, to build an atomic bomb</strong>.‚Äù</p>

<blockquote class="twitter-tweet">
<p dir="ltr" lang="en" xml:lang="en" xml:lang="en">Sobering insider account from Iran on the state of nuclear talks with the Trump admin: <a href="https://t.co/7tz5x2mwnl">https://t.co/7tz5x2mwnl</a></p>
‚Äî Aaron Mat√© (@aaronjmate) <a href="https://twitter.com/aaronjmate/status/1925473542453256481?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">May 22, 2025</a></blockquote>
<script async="" src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p>Islamic Republic News Agency (IRNA), Iran‚Äôs official news agency, reported further on Thursday that "Members of parliament have stated that Iran will never back down from its right to use nuclear technology as a member of the Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT)."</p>

<p>But again, Israel is not buying this - nor are some hawkish officials and Congressional leaders in Washington. And yet these same voices have warned that Iran has been on the threshold of building a bomb since the 1990s.¬†</p>
</div>
      <span rel="schema:author" class="field field--name-uid field--type-entity-reference field--label-hidden"><a title="View user profile." href="https://cms.zerohedge.com/users/tyler-durden" lang="" about="https://cms.zerohedge.com/users/tyler-durden" typeof="schema:Person" property="schema:name" datatype="" class="username" xml:lang="">Tyler Durden</a></span>
<span property="schema:dateCreated" content="2025-05-22T20:50:00+00:00" class="field field--name-created field--type-created field--label-hidden">Thu, 05/22/2025 - 16:50</span>


Title: ATF Launches "New Era Of Reform", Encourages Revoked Gun Dealers To Reapply 
Description: <span property="schema:name" class="field field--name-title field--type-string field--label-hidden">ATF Launches "New Era Of Reform", Encourages Revoked Gun Dealers To Reapply </span>

            <div property="schema:text" class="clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item"><p><em>Submitted by <a href="https://www.gunowners.org/">Gun Owners of America</a>,</em></p>

<p>The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF) has just announced that it's "ushering in a new chapter" of "transparency, accountability, and partnership with the firearms industry" on its official web page.</p>

<p><a data-image-external-href="" data-image-href="/s3/files/inline-images/2025-05-22_14-09-26.png?itok=26BnXFig" data-link-option="0" href="https://cms.zerohedge.com/s3/files/inline-images/2025-05-22_14-09-26.png?itok=26BnXFig"><picture><img data-entity-type="file" data-entity-uuid="0aa952d4-0701-4dd3-8f30-c49748c597bd" data-responsive-image-style="inline_images" height="381" width="500" class="inline-images image-style-inline-images" src="https://assets.zerohedge.com/s3fs-public/styles/inline_image_mobile/public/inline-images/2025-05-22_14-09-26.png?itok=26BnXFig" alt="" typeof="foaf:Image" /></picture></a></p>

<p>The most notable of these changes is that ATF has invited those Federal Firearms Licensees who had their licenses revoked by the Biden Administration's "Zero Tolerance" policy to reapply and have their license restored. This change is apparently in accordance with President Trump's executive order "Protecting Second Amendment Rights."</p>

<p><a data-image-external-href="" data-image-href="/s3/files/inline-images/2025-05-22_14-10-19.png?itok=2zB3IAz_" data-link-option="0" href="https://cms.zerohedge.com/s3/files/inline-images/2025-05-22_14-10-19.png?itok=2zB3IAz_"><picture><img data-entity-type="file" data-entity-uuid="0e4fc047-c80d-478e-b2bb-a33ca53bb242" data-responsive-image-style="inline_images" height="319" width="500" class="inline-images image-style-inline-images" src="https://assets.zerohedge.com/s3fs-public/styles/inline_image_mobile/public/inline-images/2025-05-22_14-10-19.png?itok=2zB3IAz_" alt="" typeof="foaf:Image" /></picture></a></p>

<p>Other major policy changes were also announced, including a pledge to cease "creating entirely new laws based on executive order."¬†</p>

<blockquote class="twitter-tweet">
<p dir="ltr" lang="en" xml:lang="en" xml:lang="en">üö®BREAKINGüö®<br /><br />
ATF just published a list of 10 pro-gun achievements & at least 8 more pro-gun actions that are "in progress":<br /><br />
1. Ceasing to "create entirely new laws by administrative order"<br />
2. Reversing the Biden Ban on importation of non-lethal training ammunition.<br />
3. Ending‚Ä¶</p>
‚Äî Gun Owners of America (@GunOwners) <a href="https://twitter.com/GunOwners/status/1925287534604820842?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">May 21, 2025</a></blockquote>
<script async="" src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p>This is an excellent start to improving the lives of gun owners and dealers. But not to worry, Gun Owners of America is still working on the complete and total abolishment of ATF, starting with the repealing of laws that give the agency the power to regulate.¬†</p>

<p>If those laws are not abolished, the responsibility of enforcement will be inherited by a larger agency, like the FBI or DEA. A larger, more well-funded agency would be harder to fight on the enforcement of those same unconstitutional gun laws.¬†</p>

<p>So, for the time being- while we still have to deal with the ATF, it's good to have it working on bettering its relationship with law-abiding gun owners rather than actively antagonizing them.¬†</p>

<p>GOA's Senior Vice President Erich Pratt had this to say:</p>

<blockquote>
<p><em>"This new chapter marks a rare and welcome shift, as ATF is finally working to repair the damage it's done. Encouraging wrongly targeted dealers to reapply‚Äîand pledging to stop inventing laws out of thin air‚Äîwill be a breath of fresh air for gun owners nationwide. That said, GOA remains committed to the complete abolishment of the ATF.¬†</em></p>
</blockquote>

<p>While these reforms are a step in the right direction, the end goal is to eliminate the agency's power to infringe on the rights of law-abiding gun owners, once and for all."</p>
</div>

Title: Power BI Embedded Analytics ‚Äî Part 3: Power BI Embedded Demo
Description: <p><strong>Note</strong>: This article presents the details of a Power BI Embedded Demo application. This is a continuation of<span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">&nbsp;the articles&nbsp;</span><a href="https://dzone.com/articles/introduction-power-bi-authoring-overview"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Power BI Embedded Analytics ‚Äî Part 1</span></a><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">&nbsp;and&nbsp;</span><a href="https://dzone.com/articles/power-bi-embedded-overview"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Power BI Embedded Analytics ‚Äî Part 2</span></a><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">, which discuss Power BI Authoring and Power BI Embedded. So, it is recommended that you go through the previous parts of the series</span>.</p>
<h2>Power BI Embedded Demo</h2>
<div dir="auto">
 <h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Source Code</h3><a href="https://github.com/robinrizvi/bi-poc/tree/master?tab=readme-ov-file#source-code"></a>
</div>
<p dir="auto">Github: <a href="https://github.com/robinrizvi/embedded-analytics-poc" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">https://github.com/robinrizvi/embedded-analytics-poc</a></p>

Title: System Coexistence: Bridging Legacy and Modern Architecture
Description: <h2 dir="ltr">Abstract&nbsp;</h2>
<p dir="ltr">Organizations are challenged with integrating <a href="https://dzone.com/articles/optimizing-legacy-systems-through-scalable-architectures">legacy systems</a> and modern applications in a way that ensures operational harmony and business continuity. This article explores the concept of system coexistence, the ability of diverse software systems built across different eras and architectures to function together within shared environments. It delves into practical strategies for achieving coexistence, such as the <a href="https://dzone.com/articles/how-the-strangler-fig-approach-can-revitalize-comp">Strangler Fig Pattern</a>, adapter-based decoupling, and event-driven communication models. The article also addresses critical supporting aspects like data coexistence, <a href="https://dzone.com/monitoring-and-observability">observability</a>, and performance monitoring, emphasizing that coexistence is not merely a transitional phase but a strategic imperative for sustainable growth and innovation. Drawing on real-world examples, such as Netflix‚Äôs cloud migration and the HealthCare.gov launch failure, this piece provides a roadmap for organizations to navigate coexistence successfully while preparing for scalable, future-ready systems.</p>
<h2 dir="ltr">Introduction</h2>
<p dir="ltr">We live in a world where it's easy to assume that all our applications built at different times, using the "best" technologies of their era will seamlessly integrate and continue to function in harmony. Yet, time and again, we‚Äôre proven wrong.</p>

Title: The Role of AI in Identity and Access Management for Organizations
Description: <h2 style="text-align: left;">Introduction</h2>
<p style="text-align: left;"><a href="https://dzone.com/refcardz/identity-and-access-management-2">Identity and Access Management (IAM)&nbsp;</a>is a key pillar of any organization. It plays a vital role in enterprise security‚Äîsecuring the resources and the data of an organization by making sure only authorized users have access. As the IT infrastructure of organizations is growing exponentially and increasing cyber threats, rule based IAM solutions are often insufficient.</p>
<p style="text-align: left;">To enhance security, streamline processes, reduce operational costs, and adapt to evolving threats, organizations are integrating their IAM systems with Artificial Intelligence (AI). This article examines the technical aspects of how AI is driving a change in IAM for organizations.</p>

Title: Assessing Bias in AI Chatbot Responses
Description: <h2 style="text-align: left;"><strong><span lang="">Abstract</span></strong></h2>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span lang="">AI communication in the form of chatbots has brought about a new paradigm of communication and service delivery through the use of&nbsp;</span><a href="https://dzone.com/articles/decoding-large-language-models-and-how-they-work"><span lang="">large language models</span></a><span lang="">&nbsp;(LLMs) like GPT. However, as these technologies are applied in daily life, questions about the bias of the answers given by chatbots also arise. In this paper, the focus will be on discussing the ethical considerations of AI chatbots, including the detection of bias, fairness, and transparency. Bias detection techniques described in the study include fairness metrics, sensitivity analysis, and bias correction algorithms. It also emphasizes the importance of diverse training data and the integration of ethical protocols to avoid radiating bias. The consequences of bias in AI chatbots are explored in a range of cases and actual-life scenarios in settings including healthcare, recruitment, and customer relations and service. The study draws attention to the fact that more work has to be done to make certain that AI chatbots are designed and utilized in a way that is ethical and not deceptive.</span></p>
<h2 style="text-align: left;"><strong><span lang="">Keywords</span></strong></h2>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span lang="">AI Chatbots, Bias Detection, Fairness Metrics, Transparency, Ethical AI, Bias Mitigation, Generative Pretrained Transformers (GPT), Chatbot Development, Ethical Guidelines, Artificial Intelligence</span></p>

Title: Knowledge Graph Embeddings and NLP Innovations
Description: <p>Knowledge Graph Question Answering (KGQA) systems facilitate the structuring of typical natural language queries and consequently retrieve specific, relevant information from knowledge graphs efficiently. Given new advances in <a href="https://dzone.com/articles/supercharge-llms-with-knowledge-graphs">Knowledge Graph</a> Embeddings (KGEs) and the sophistication of <a href="https://dzone.com/refcardz/getting-started-with-large-language-models">Large Language Models (LLMs)</a>, significant strides are being made in understanding complex semantic relationships and multi-hop queries. This article provides a comprehensive examination of embedding methodologies, particularly emphasizing advanced negative sampling strategies, and discusses the deployment of cutting-edge NLP architectures, such as RoBERTa, to enhance query representation and retrieval accuracy.</p>
<h2><strong>Problem Synopsis and Importance</strong></h2>
<p>Current KGQA frameworks face substantial obstacles in accurately interpreting, extracting, and reasoning over intricate relational data patterns present in multi-hop queries. These questions are notoriously nuanced and call for the ability to draw complex distinctions and conclusions. Unfortunately, conventional embedding techniques can miss the nuances of these relationships across the entire knowledge graph space, limiting the reliability and performance of KGQA systems. Better continual refinement of knowledge graph embeddings using more sophisticated negative sampling methods and more detailed NLP models creates excellent opportunities for enhancing query interpretation and answer precision.</p>

</blockquote>

Title: Regulate microplastics in drinking water | Science
Description: Microplastic pollution is an emerging but underregulated threat to public health (1‚Äì3). Microplastics have the potential to harm human organs and biological systems (4 ‚Äì6), yet no country has yet established standards to regulate their presence in drinking water. The US state of California has implemented standardized microplastic testing for drinking water (7), and the European Union (EU) introduced a harmonized measurement methodology across its Member States in 2024 (8), but these initiatives lack full regulatory integration. To protect public health, international health authorities and governments should identify and mitigate microplastic contamination by incorporating microplastic limits into drinking water standards.

<p style="text-align: left;">ËÄÉËôëÂà∞È´òÊòÇÁöÑÂÖ≥Á®éÁ®éÁéá‰∏≠ÊúâÂ∞ÜÊúâÂæàÂ§ß‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜÈó¥Êé•Áî±ÁæéÂõΩÊ∂àË¥πËÄÖÊîØ‰ªòÔºåPrivorotskyËÆ§‰∏∫Ôºå<strong>ËÇ°Â∏ÇÁöÑÈ£éÈô©‰∏éÂõûÊä•ÊØîÁúãËµ∑Êù•ÂæàÂ∑ÆÔºö</strong></p>
<blockquote>

Description:  <p>ÁâπÊúóÊôÆÊñ∞ÂáèÁ®éÊ≥ïÊ°àÂØπÊ∏ÖÊ¥ÅËÉΩÊ∫êË°å‰∏öÈÄ†ÊàêÈáçÂàõÔºåËæÉÈ¢ÑÊúüÊõ¥‰∏∫ÊøÄËøõÁöÑË°•Ë¥¥ÂâäÂáèÂØºËá¥ÂÖâ‰ºèÊùøÂùóÊö¥Ë∑å„ÄÇ</p> <p>Âë®ÂõõÔºåÁâπÊúóÊôÆÁöÑÂáèÁ®éÊ≥ïÊ°àÂú®ÂÖ±ÂíåÂÖöÊéßÂà∂ÁöÑ‰ºóËÆÆÈô¢‰ª•ÂæÆÂº±‰ºòÂäøÈÄöËøáÔºåÁæéÂõΩÂèØÂÜçÁîüËÉΩÊ∫êËÇ°Á•®ÈöèÂç≥Â§ßÂπÖ‰∏ãÊå´„ÄÇÊçÆÂ™í‰ΩìÊä•ÈÅìÔºå<strong>ËØ•Ê≥ïÊ°àÂØªÊ±ÇÊèêÂâçÁªìÊùüÊ∏ÖÊ¥ÅËÉΩÊ∫êÁ®éÊî∂ÊäµÂÖçÔºåËøô‰∫õÊäµÂÖçÊõæÊòØÊãúÁôªÊîøÂ∫ú„ÄäÈÄöËÉÄÂâäÂáèÊ≥ïÊ°à„Äã(IRA)ÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉÊîØÊü±</strong>„ÄÇ</p> <p>‰ΩèÂÆÖÂ§™Èò≥ËÉΩË°å‰∏öÂèóÂà∞ÁöÑÊâìÂáªÂ∞§‰∏∫‰∏•Èáç„ÄÇ5Êúà12Êó•ÁöÑÊ≥ïÊ°àÂéüËçâÊ°àÂâäÂáè‰∫ÜË¥≠‰π∞Â§™Èò≥ËÉΩÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑÊàø‰∏ªÁöÑÁ®éÊî∂ÊäµÂÖç„ÄÇË¢´Áß∞‰∏∫48EÁöÑÊäïËµÑÁ®éÊî∂ÊäµÂÖçÂéüÂÆöÁ®çÂêéÈÄêÊ≠•ÂèñÊ∂àÔºå‰ΩÜ<strong>ËØ•Ê≥ïÊ°àÊúÄÊñ∞ÁâàÊú¨Âä†Âø´‰∫ÜËøô‰∏ÄÂïÜ‰∏öÂÆâË£ÖË°•Ë¥¥ÁöÑÂâäÂáèËøõÂ∫¶</strong>„ÄÇ</p> <p>Âë®ÂõõÁæéËÇ°Êî∂ÁõòÔºå‰ª•ÁæéÂõΩËÇ°Á•®‰∏∫‰∏ªÁöÑInvescoÂ§™Èò≥ËÉΩETFÂáÄËµÑ‰∫ßÂÄº‰∏ãË∑åÈ´òËææ10%„ÄÇ‰∏•Èáç‰æùËµñ48EËµÑÊ†ºÁöÑSunrunÊö¥Ë∑åËøë40%ÔºåÂç≥‰æøÁæéÂõΩÊúÄÂ§ßÂèØÂÜçÁîüËÉΩÊ∫êÂºÄÂèëÂïÜNextEra Energy‰πüÊî∂Áõò‰∏ãË∑å6.4%„ÄÇ</p> <p><img class=" wscnph" src="https://wpimg-wscn.awtmt.com/1dd62660-85d7-4ab3-b53d-397abfda986c.png" data-wscntype="image" data-wscnh="487" data-wscnw="676"/></p> <p>ÂàÜÊûêÂ∏àË≠¶ÂëäÁß∞ÔºåÁªøËâ≤ËÉΩÊ∫êËÇ°ÂèØËÉΩËøò‰ºöËøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•‰∏ãË∑å„ÄÇÊ≥ïÂõΩÂÖ¥‰∏öÈì∂Ë°åÁæéÂõΩËÇ°Á•®Á≠ñÁï•‰∏ªÁÆ°Manish KabraË°®Á§∫Ôºö</p> <blockquote>

Title:  ÁæéÂõΩÊöÇÂÅúÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÊãõÊî∂ÂõΩÈôÖÂ≠¶ÁîüËµÑÊ†ºÔºåÂú®Ê†°Â§ñÂõΩÂ≠¶ÁîüËΩ¨Â≠¶‚ÄúÂê¶ÂàôÂ∞ÜÂ§±ÂéªÂêàÊ≥ïË∫´‰ªΩ‚Äù 
Description:  <p data-start="0" data-end="51">ÁâπÊúóÊôÆÊîøÂ∫ú‰∫éÂë®Âõõ‰∏≠Ê≠¢‰∫ÜÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÊãõÊî∂ÂõΩÈôÖÂ≠¶ÁîüÁöÑËµÑÊ†ºÔºåÁâπÊúóÊôÆÊîøÂ∫úÈÄöÁü•Âìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÔºåÁ¶ÅÊ≠¢ÂÖ∂ÊãõÊî∂ÂõΩÈôÖÂ≠¶Áîü„ÄÇ</p>
<p data-start="0" data-end="51">ÁæéÂõΩÊîøÂ∫úÊí§ÈîÄ‰∫ÜÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑÂ≠¶Áîü‰∏é‰∫§ÊµÅËÆøÈóÆÂ≠¶ËÄÖÈ°πÁõÆÔºàSEVPÔºâËÆ§ËØÅÔºåÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄËØ•Ê†°‰ªäÂêé‰∏çÂæóÂÜçÊãõÊî∂Â§ñÂõΩÂ≠¶Áîü„ÄÇÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÂúüÂÆâÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÈïøÂÖãÈáåÊñØËíÇ¬∑ËØ∫ÂßÜÔºàKristi NoemÔºâËá¥Âìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂ∞Å‰ø°‰∏≠ÂÜôÈÅìÔºö‚ÄúÊàëÂú®Ê≠§ÈÄöÁü•ÊÇ®ÔºåËá™Âç≥Êó•Ëµ∑ÔºåÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑÂ≠¶Áîü‰∏é‰∫§ÊµÅËÆøÈóÆÂ≠¶ËÄÖÈ°πÁõÆÔºàSEVPÔºâËÆ§ËØÅË¢´Êí§ÈîÄ„ÄÇ‚Äù</p>
<p data-start="0" data-end="51"><strong>Ê≠§‰∏æÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶Â∞ÜÊó†Ê≥ïÂÜçÊãõÊî∂ÂõΩÈôÖÂ≠¶ÁîüÔºåÁé∞ÊúâÁöÑÂ§ñÂõΩÂ≠¶ÁîüÂøÖÈ°ªËΩ¨Â≠¶ÔºåÂê¶ÂàôÂ∞ÜÂ§±ÂéªÂêàÊ≥ïË∫´‰ªΩ„ÄÇ</strong></p>
<p data-start="0" data-end="51">ÁâπÊúóÊôÆÊîøÂ∫úÁöÑËøô‰∏ÄÂÜ≥ÂÆöÊòØÂú®ÁæéÂõΩÊîøÂ∫úÂÜªÁªìÊï∞ÂçÅ‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉËÅîÈÇ¶ËµÑÈáëÂêéÔºåÂØπÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÈÄ†ÊàêÁöÑÊúÄÊñ∞ÈáçÂ§ßÊâìÂáª„ÄÇ<strong>ËøôÊ†áÂøóÁùÄÁâπÊúóÊôÆÊîøÂ∫ú‰∏éÁæéÂõΩÁ≤æËã±È´òÊ†°ÁöÑÂØπÁ´ãËøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•ÂçáÁ∫ßÔºåÂÜ≤Á™ÅÊé®ÂêëÂâçÊâÄÊú™ÊúâÁöÑÈ´òÂ∫¶„ÄÇ</strong></p>
<p data-start="0" data-end="51">Ê†πÊçÆÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶Êï∞ÊçÆÔºåËØ•Ê†°ÁõÆÂâçÁ∫¶Êúâ6800ÂêçÂõΩÈôÖÂ≠¶ÁîüÔºåÂç†Â≠¶ÁîüÊÄªÊï∞ÁöÑ27%ÔºåÁõ∏ÊØî2006Âπ¥ÁöÑ19.6%ÊúâÊòæËëóÂ¢ûÈïø„ÄÇÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÂúüÂÆâÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÈïøNoemÁß∞ÔºåÊúâÂÖ≥Âìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑÂëΩ‰ª§ÂΩ±ÂìçÂ§öËææ27%ÁöÑÂú®Ê†°Áîü„ÄÇËøô‰πüÊòØÁâπÊúóÊôÆÊîøÂ∫úÂØπÂÖ∂‰ªñÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑË≠¶Âëä„ÄÇ</p>
<h2>ÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÂúüÂÆâÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÈÉ®ÈïøËá¥‰ø°Âìà‰Ωõ</h2>
<p data-start="0" data-end="51"><a href="https://content-static.cctvnews.cctv.com/snow-book/index.html?item_id=5225276109837222549&amp;t=1747944249003&amp;toc_style_id=feeds_default&amp;track_id=BC53BA29-AEED-49FA-ACB6-BB66867A7FE0_769643696185&amp;share_to=copy_url" target="_blank" rel="noopener">ÊçÆÂ§ÆËßÜÊñ∞Èóª</a>ÔºåÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÂúüÂÆâÂÖ®ÈÉ®5Êúà22Êó•Ë°®Á§∫ÔºåÁâπÊúóÊôÆÊîøÂ∫úÂ∑≤ÊöÇÂÅúÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÊãõÊî∂ÂõΩÈôÖÂ≠¶ÁîüÁöÑËµÑÊ†º„ÄÇÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÂúüÂÆâÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÈÉ®ÈïøÂÖãÈáåÊñØËíÇ¬∑ËØ∫ÂßÜÂú®Ëá¥Âìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂ∞Å‰ø°‰∏≠Ë°®Á§∫Ôºö</p>
<blockquote>
<p data-start="0" data-end="51">Âìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑÂ≠¶ÁîüÂíå‰∫§ÊµÅËÆøÈóÆËÄÖÈ°πÁõÆÔºàSEVPÔºâËÆ§ËØÅÂç≥Êó•Ëµ∑Ë¢´Êí§ÈîÄ„ÄÇ</p>
<p data-source="cke">Ê≠§Ê¨°ËÆ§ËØÅÊí§ÈîÄÂ∞Ü‰ΩøÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶Âú®2025-2026Â≠¶Âπ¥‰∏çÂæóÊãõÊî∂‰ªª‰ΩïÊåÅFÁ±ªÊàñJÁ±ªÈùûÁßªÊ∞ëË∫´‰ªΩÁöÑÂ§ñÁ±çÂ≠¶Áîü„ÄÇÊ≠§Â§ñÔºåÁé∞ÊúâÊåÅFÁ±ªÊàñJÁ±ªÈùûÁßªÊ∞ëË∫´‰ªΩÁöÑÂ≠¶ÁîüÂøÖÈ°ªËΩ¨Â≠¶Ëá≥ÂÖ∂‰ªñÈ´òÊ†°ÔºåÂê¶ÂàôÂ∞ÜÊó†Ê≥ïÁª¥ÊåÅÂÖ∂ÈùûÁßªÊ∞ëË∫´‰ªΩ„ÄÇ</p>
</blockquote>
<p data-source="cke"><strong>Ê≠§Â§ñÔºåÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÂúüÂÆâÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÈÉ®ÈïøËØ∫ÂßÜÂΩìÊó•ËøòÂú®Á¶èÂÖãÊñØÊñ∞ÈóªÈááËÆø‰∏≠Áß∞ÔºåÊ≠£ËÄÉËôëÂú®ÂÖ∂‰ªñÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÈááÂèñÁ±ª‰ºº‰∏æÊé™„ÄÇ</strong></p>
<p data-start="53" data-end="112">ÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÂúüÂÆâÂÖ®ÈÉ®Âú®Â£∞Êòé‰∏≠ÊåáÂá∫Ôºö‚ÄúÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑÁÆ°ÁêÜÂ±ÇÈÄöËøáÁ∫µÂÆπÂèçÁæé„ÄÅÊîØÊåÅÊÅêÊÄñ‰∏ª‰πâÁöÑÁÖΩÂä®ËÄÖÈ™öÊâ∞Âπ∂ÊîªÂáª‰∏™‰∫∫ÔºåÂåÖÊã¨Â§öÂêçÁäπÂ§™Â≠¶ÁîüÔºå‰∏•ÈáçÁ†¥Âùè‰∫ÜÂÖ∂ÊõæÁªèÂ£∞Ë™âÂçìËëóÁöÑÂ≠¶ÊúØÁéØÂ¢ÉÔºå‰ªéËÄåÈÄ†ÊàêÊ†°Âõ≠‰∏çÂÆâÂÖ®„ÄÇ‚Äù</p>
<p data-start="53" data-end="112">NoemËØ¥ÔºåÂ§ßÂ≠¶ËÉΩÂ§üÊãõÊî∂ÂõΩÈôÖÂ≠¶ÁîüÂπ∂ÂÄüÊ≠§Ëé∑ÂæóÈ´òÈ¢ùÂ≠¶Ë¥π‰ª•Ë°•ÂÖÖÂÖ∂Êï∞ÂçÅ‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑÊçêËµ†Âü∫ÈáëÔºåÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÁâπÊùÉÔºåËÄåÈùûÊùÉÂà©„ÄÇ</p>
<p data-start="53" data-end="112">NoemÊõæÂú®4ÊúàË¶ÅÊ±ÇÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶Âú®4Êúà30Êó•ÂâçÊèê‰∫§ÊâÄÊúâÊ∂âÂ§ñÂ≠¶ÁîüÊ∂âÂèäÊö¥ÂäõÊàñÈùûÊ≥ïË°å‰∏∫ÁöÑËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåÂê¶ÂàôÂ∞ÜÁ´ãÂç≥Â§±ÂéªÂÖ∂ËÅîÈÇ¶Â≠¶ÁîüÁ≠æËØÅÈ°πÁõÆÁöÑËÆ§ËØÅ„ÄÇ</p>
<h2 data-start="53" data-end="112">Âìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÔºöÂõΩÂúüÂÆâÂÖ®ÈÉ®Ê≠§‰∏æ‚ÄúËøùÊ≥ï‚Äù</h2>

<blockquote>
<p data-start="0" data-end="20">Êàë‰ª¨ÂÆåÂÖ®Ëá¥Âäõ‰∫éÁª¥Êä§Âìà‰ΩõÊé•Á∫≥Êù•Ëá™140Â§ö‰∏™ÂõΩÂÆ∂ÁöÑÂõΩÈôÖÂ≠¶ÁîüÂíåÂ≠¶ËÄÖÁöÑËÉΩÂäõÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨‰∏∫Êú¨Ê†°‚Äî‚Äî‰πÉËá≥Êï¥‰∏™ÂõΩÂÆ∂‚Äî‚ÄîÂ∏¶Êù•‰∫ÜÈöæ‰ª•‰º∞ÈáèÁöÑ‰ª∑ÂÄº„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨Ê≠£Âú®ËøÖÈÄüÈááÂèñÊé™ÊñΩÔºå‰∏∫Ê†°ÂÜÖÁ§æÂå∫ÊàêÂëòÊèê‰æõÊåáÂØº‰∏éÊîØÊåÅ„ÄÇ</p>

<h2 data-start="53" data-end="112">Âìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÈÄâÊã©‚ÄúÁ°¨Âàö‚Äù</h2>
<p data-source="cke">ËøëÊúüÔºåÁæéÂõΩËÅîÈÇ¶ÊîøÂ∫ú‰ª•ÂÜªÁªìËÅîÈÇ¶ÁªèË¥π‰∏∫Ë¶ÅÊåüÔºåË¶ÅÊ±ÇÂ§öÊâÄÈ´òÊ†°‚ÄúÊï¥Êîπ‚ÄùÔºåÁæéÂõΩËëóÂêçÁßÅÁ´ãÂ≠¶Â∫úÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÂàôÈÄâÊã©‚ÄúÁ°¨Âàö‚Äù„ÄÇÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶4Êúà14Êó•ÊãíÁªù‰∫ÜÁâπÊúóÊôÆÊîøÂ∫úÊèêÂá∫ÁöÑÂØπÂÖ∂ÁÆ°ÁêÜÁªìÊûÑ„ÄÅÊãõËÅòÂèäÊãõÁîüÊîøÁ≠ñËøõË°åÂ§ßÂπÖÊîπÈù©ÁöÑË¶ÅÊ±Ç„ÄÇÁæéÂõΩÊîøÂ∫úÈöèÂç≥ÂÆ£Â∏ÉÂÜªÁªìËØ•Ê†°ÊÄªÈ¢ùÁ∫¶22.6‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑËÅîÈÇ¶ÁªèË¥π„ÄÇ</p>

<p><a href="https://wallstreetcn.com/articles/3744997" target="_blank" rel="noopener">ÂçéÂ∞îË°óËßÅÈóª</a>Ê≠§ÂâçÊèêÂà∞ÔºåÂáèÁ®éÊ°àËøõÂÖ•ÂèÇËÆÆÈô¢ÊäïÁ•®ÂèØ‰ª•Ëµ∞‚ÄúÂø´ËΩ¶ÈÅì‚ÄùÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÂÖ±ÂíåÂÖö‰∫∫‰∏äÊúàËß£ÈîÅ‰∫Ü&#34;È¢ÑÁÆóÂçèË∞É&#34;Êú∫Âà∂„ÄÇ</p>
<p>ËØ•Êú∫Âà∂ÂÖÅËÆ∏ÂÖ±ÂíåÂÖö‰∫∫ÁªïËøáÂèÇËÆÆÈô¢ÁöÑ&#34;ÂÜóÈïøËæ©ËÆ∫&#34;(filibuster)ËßÑÂàôÔºåÂÖ±ÂíåÂÖöÂèØ‰ª•Âú®Ê≤°ÊúâÊ∞ë‰∏ªÂÖöËÆÆÂëòÊîØÊåÅÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºå‰ªÖ‰ª•ÁÆÄÂçïÂ§öÊï∞Á•®Â∞±ÈÄöËøáÁâπÊúóÊôÆÁöÑÊ≥ïÊ°àÔºåÊó†ÈúÄÈÄöÂ∏∏Âú®ÂèÇËÆÆÈô¢Êé®Âä®Ê≥ïÊ°àÊâÄÈúÄÁöÑ60Á•®„ÄÇ</p>
<p>‰∏çËøáÔºåÂ∞±ÁÆóÊòØË¶ÅÂáëÈΩêÁÆÄÂçïÂ§öÊï∞Á•®ÔºåÂèÇËÆÆÈô¢ÁöÑÂÖ±ÂíåÂÖöÈ¢ÜË¢ñ‰πüÂæóÂÖàÊääÂÜÖÈÉ®Âè£ÂæÑÁªü‰∏ÄËµ∑Êù•„ÄÇÂ™í‰ΩìÊåáÂá∫ÔºåÂ§ö‰ΩçÂÖ±ÂíåÂÖöÂèÇËÆÆÂëòÂ∑≤Ë°®Á§∫Ôºå‰ªñ‰ª¨Â∞ÜË¶ÅÊ±ÇÂØπËØ•Ê≥ïÊ°àËøõË°åÈáçÂ§ß‰øÆÊîπÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÊâç‰ºöÂêåÊÑèÊäïÁ•®ÊîØÊåÅ„ÄÇ</p>
<p>ÂØÜËãèÈáåÂ∑ûÁöÑÂÖ±ÂíåÂÖöÂèÇËÆÆÂëòJosh HawleyÁ≠â‰øùÂÆàÊ¥æ‰∫∫Â£´Â∑≤Ë≠¶ÂëäÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊ≥ïÊ°àÂâäÂáèÂåªÁñóË°•Âä©È°πÁõÆ‰∏ãÁöÑÂÅ•Â∫∑Á¶èÂà©Ôºå‰ªñ‰ª¨Â∞ÜÂèçÂØπ‰ªª‰Ωï‰∏ÄÊèΩÂ≠êËÆ°Âàí„ÄÇ</p>

Title:  ËãπÊûú„ÄÅÁâπÊñØÊãâ„ÄÅËã±‰ºüËææÁ≠âÁÉ≠Èó®ËÇ°Â∞ÜÂú®Kraken‰∫§ÊòìÂπ≥Âè∞‰∏ä‰ª•‰ª£Â∏ÅÂΩ¢Âºè‰∫§Êòì 
Description:  <p>Âë®ÂõõÔºåÊçÆÂ™í‰ΩìÊä•ÈÅìÔºåËãπÊûú„ÄÅÁâπÊñØÊãâ„ÄÅËã±‰ºüËææÁ≠âÁÉ≠Èó®ÁæéËÇ°Â∞ÜÂú®Âä†ÂØÜË¥ßÂ∏Å‰∫§ÊòìÂπ≥Âè∞Kraken‰∏ä‰ª•‰ª£Â∏ÅÂΩ¢Âºè‰∫§Êòì„ÄÇKrakenËÆ°ÂàíÂÖÅËÆ∏ÈùûÁæéÂõΩÂÆ¢Êà∑‰∫§ÊòìËãπÊûúÁ≠âËÇ°Á•®ÔºåËøô‰∏™Êñ∞ËÆ°ÂàíÂ∞ÜÂú®Êú™Êù•Âá†Âë®ÂÜÖÂêØÂä®„ÄÇ</p>

Title:  ÁâπÊúóÊôÆÊâ©Â§ßËµ§Â≠óÔºåÁæéÂÖÉÊØîÁæéÂÄ∫ÂéãÂäõÊõ¥Â§ß 
Description:  <p>Âæ∑Èì∂Ë≠¶ÂëäÔºåÁæéÂõΩË¥¢ÊîøÈ£éÈô©ÊåÅÁª≠‰∏ãÔºåÁæéÂÄ∫ËÉΩÊíë‰ΩèÔºåÁæéÂÖÉÊíë‰∏ç‰Ωè„ÄÇ</p>
<p>ÊçÆËøΩÈ£é‰∫§ÊòìÂè∞Ê∂àÊÅØÔºå5Êúà21Êó•ÔºåÂæ∑Èì∂ÂèëÂ∏ÉÁ†îÊä•ÊåáÂá∫ÔºåÁæéÂÖÉÂΩìÂâçÈù¢‰∏¥ÁöÑÊúÄÂ§ßÂ®ÅËÉÅÔºåÂèØËÉΩ‰∏çÊòØÂà´ÁöÑÔºåËÄåÊòØÁæéÂõΩÊîøÂ∫úËá™Ë∫´ÁöÑË¥¢ÊîøÁä∂ÂÜµ„ÄÇÁõÆÂâçÁæéÂõΩË¥¢Êîø‚Äú‰∏çÁ°ÆÂÆöÊÄßÊåáÊï∞‚ÄùÈ£ôÂà∞ÂéÜÂè≤Êñ∞È´òÔºåÊ∫êÂ§¥ÊòØÁ®éÊîπ„ÄÅËµ§Â≠ó‰∫âËÆÆ‰∏çÊñ≠„ÄÇ</p>

<p>Âõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÊäïËµÑËÄÖÂØπÁæéÂÄ∫ÂÖ¥Ë∂£ÂáèÂº±Ôºå30Âπ¥ÊúüÂíå20Âπ¥ÊúüÁæéÂÄ∫Êî∂ÁõäÁéáÂèåÂèåÁ™ÅÁ†¥5%ÔºåÊú¨Â∫îÊõ¥ÂÖ∑Âê∏ÂºïÂäõÔºå‰ΩÜÊúÄÊñ∞20Âπ¥ÊúüÂõΩÂÄ∫ÁöÑÊãçÂçñÁªìÊûúÂç¥Ë°®Áé∞‰∏ç‰Ω≥ÔºåÊòæÁ§∫Êµ∑Â§ñËµÑÈáëÊ≠£Âú®ÊÇÑÁÑ∂Êí§Á¶ª„ÄÇÁæéÂÄ∫Êú™Êù•ÂèØËÉΩÈúÄË¶ÅÁæéÂõΩÊú¨ÂúüÊú∫ÊûÑÊù•Êé•Áõò„ÄÇ</p>
<p>Âç≥‰ΩøÁæéÂõΩÊú∫ÊûÑÊé•ÊâãÁæéÂÄ∫Ôºå‰πüÊó†Ê≥ïÊäµÊ∂àÂ§ñËµÑÊí§Âá∫ÂØπÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑÊâìÂáª„ÄÇÂõ†‰∏∫Êú¨ÂúüÊú∫ÊûÑÊ≤°ÊúâÈÇ£‰πàÂ§öÊµ∑Â§ñËµÑ‰∫ßÂèØ‰ª•‚ÄúÂçñ‰∫ÜÊç¢ÁæéÂÖÉ‚ÄùÊù•ÂØπÂÜ≤Ëøô‰∏™Á©∫Áº∫ÔºåÂ§ñÊ±áÊµÅÂá∫ÊòØÂÆûÊâìÂÆûÁöÑ„ÄÇ</p>
<h2>Â§ñËµÑÊí§Á¶ªÔºåÁæéÂÄ∫ÊàñÁ®≥ÔºåÊ±áÁéáÈöæ‰øù</h2>
<p>Âæ∑Èì∂ÊåáÂá∫ÔºåÁæéÂõΩ‚ÄúË¥¢ÊîøÊîøÁ≠ñ‰∏çÁ°ÆÂÆöÊÄßÊåáÊï∞‚ÄùÂ∑≤È£ôÂçáËá≥ÂéÜÂè≤Êñ∞È´òÔºå‰∏ªË¶ÅÊ∫ê‰∫éÂõ¥ÁªïÁ®éÊîπ„ÄÅË¥¢ÊîøËµ§Â≠ó‰∏éÈïøÊúüÈ¢ÑÁÆóÂâçÊôØÁöÑÊåÅÁª≠‰∫âËÆÆ„ÄÇËÄåÊõ¥Á≥üÁöÑÊòØÔºåÂú®ÁªèÊµéÁä∂ÂÜµÂπ∂‰∏çÂ∑ÆÁöÑËÉåÊôØ‰∏ãÔºåÁæéÂõΩÁöÑË¥¢ÊîøËµ§Â≠óÂç¥ÂºÇÂ∏∏Â∑®Â§ß„ÄÅ‰∏îÈöæ‰ª•ÊåÅÁª≠„ÄÇ</p>

<p>Êú¨ÊñáÊù•Ëá™ÂçéÂ∞îË°óËßÅÈóªÔºåÊ¨¢Ëøé‰∏ãËΩΩAPPÊü•ÁúãÊõ¥Â§ö</p> 

Title:  Ê¨ßÂÖÉÂå∫5ÊúàPMIÊÑèÂ§ñËêéÁº©ÔºåÊúçÂä°‰∏öÂàõ16‰∏™ÊúàÊù•ÊúÄÂ∑ÆË°®Áé∞ 
Description:  <p>Ê¨ßÂÖÉÂå∫ÁªèÊµéÂú®5ÊúàÊÑèÂ§ñËêéÁº©ÔºåÊúçÂä°‰∏öË°®Áé∞Ë∑åËá≥16‰∏™Êúà‰ª•Êù•ÊúÄÂ∑ÆÊ∞¥Âπ≥ÔºåÂà∂ÈÄ†‰∏öÁöÑÂ∞èÂπÖÊîπÂñÑË¢´ÊúçÂä°‰∏öÁöÑ‰∏ãË∑åÊâÄÊäµÊ∂à„ÄÇ</p>
<p>22Êó•ÔºåS&amp;P GlobalÂèëÂ∏ÉÁöÑÈááË¥≠ÁªèÁêÜ‰∫∫ÊåáÊï∞ÔºàPMIÔºâÊòæÁ§∫Ôºö</p>

<ul>
<li>Ê¨ßÂÖÉÂå∫ÁªºÂêàPMIÊåáÊï∞‰ªé4ÊúàÁöÑ50.4ÈôçËá≥49.5Ôºå‰Ωé‰∫éÂàÜÊûêÂ∏àÊ≠§ÂâçÈ¢ÑÊµãÁöÑ50.6Ôºõ</li>

</blockquote>
<p>Ê≥ïÂõΩÁöÑÁªèÊµéÊ¥ªÂä®Â∑≤ËøûÁª≠9‰∏™ÊúàËêéÁº©ÔºåÁªºÂêàPMI‰ªÖ‰ªé4Êúà‰ªΩÁöÑ47.8Â∞èÂπÖ‰∏äÂçáËá≥48Ôºå‰æùÊóßËøú‰Ωé‰∫é50ÁöÑÈó®Êßõ„ÄÇÂæ∑Ê≥ïÊúçÂä°‰∏öÊ¥ªÂä®ÂùáÂá∫Áé∞‰∏ãË∑å„ÄÇ</p>
<p>Êï∞ÊçÆÂèëÂ∏ÉÂêéÔºåË¥ßÂ∏ÅÂ∏ÇÂú∫Âä†Â§ß‰∫ÜÂØπÊ¨ßÊ¥≤Â§ÆË°å‰ªäÂπ¥Â∞ÜÂÜçÈôçÊÅØ‰∏§Ê¨°ÁöÑÊäºÊ≥®„ÄÇÂØπÊîøÁ≠ñÊïèÊÑüÁöÑÂæ∑ÂõΩ‰∏§Âπ¥ÊúüÂõΩÂÄ∫Êî∂ÁõäÁéá‰∏ãË∑å3‰∏™Âü∫ÁÇπËá≥1.84%„ÄÇÊ¨ßÂÖÉÂÖëÁæéÂÖÉÊ±áÁéáÊâ©Â§ßË∑åÂπÖÔºå‰∏ÄÂ∫¶‰∏ãË∑å0.3%Ëá≥1.1296ÁæéÂÖÉ„ÄÇ</p>

<h2>Ê¨ßÂÖÉÂå∫ÁßÅËê•ÈÉ®Èó®Ê¥ªÂä®ÊÑèÂ§ñÊî∂Áº©ÔºåÊúçÂä°‰∏öË°®Áé∞Áñ≤ËΩØÊòØ‰∏ªË¶ÅÊãñÁ¥Ø</h2>
<p>Ê†πÊçÆS&amp;P GlobalÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÊòæÁ§∫ÔºåÊ¨ßÂÖÉÂå∫5ÊúàÁßÅËê•ÈÉ®Èó®Ê¥ªÂä®ÊÑèÂ§ñËêéÁº©„ÄÇÊ±âÂ†°ÂïÜ‰∏öÈì∂Ë°åÁöÑÁªèÊµéÂ≠¶ÂÆ∂Cyrus de la RubiaË°®Á§∫Ôºö</p>

</blockquote>
<p>‰ªñÊåáÂá∫ÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂ÊúçÂä°‰∏öÁöÑÂõΩÂ§ñÈúÄÊ±ÇÊúâÊâÄÊîæÁºìÔºå<strong>‰ΩÜÂõΩÂÜÖÈúÄÊ±ÇÁöÑÁñ≤ËΩØÊâçÊòØÊãñÁ¥ØËØ•Ë°å‰∏öÁöÑ‰∏ªË¶ÅÂéüÂõ†„ÄÇ</strong>ÊúçÂä°‰∏öÁöÑÁñ≤ËΩØË°®Áé∞ÊòØÂØºËá¥Êï¥‰ΩìPMI‰∏ãÈôçÁöÑÂÖ≥ÈîÆÂõ†Á¥†ÔºåËøôÈ¢ÑÁ§∫ÁùÄÊ¨ßÂÖÉÂå∫ÁªèÊµéÂ§çËãèÁöÑÈÅìË∑ØÂ∞ÜÊõ¥Âä†Ëâ∞Èöæ„ÄÇ</p>
<p>5Êúà‰ªΩÊ¨ßÂÖÉÂå∫Âà∂ÈÄ†‰∏öÁöÑË°®Áé∞Â•Ω‰∫éÊúçÂä°‰∏öÔºåËøôÊòØËá™Áñ´ÊÉÖÁàÜÂèë‰ª•Êù•È¶ñÊ¨°Âá∫Áé∞ÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ„ÄÇDe la RubiaËÆ§‰∏∫ÔºåËøôÂèØËÉΩ‰∏éÂ∫îÂØπÁæéÂõΩË¥∏ÊòìÂÖ≥Á®éÁöÑÊé™ÊñΩÊúâÂÖ≥ÔºåËÄåËæÉ‰ΩéÁöÑÊ≤π‰ª∑‰πüÂèØËÉΩÂØπÊ≠§ÊúâÊâÄÂ∏ÆÂä©„ÄÇÊ¨ßÂÖÉÂå∫Âà∂ÈÄ†‰∏öÂ∑≤ËøûÁª≠‰∏â‰∏™ÊúàÂ¢ûÂä†‰∫ßÈáèÔºåÊñ∞ËÆ¢ÂçïËá™2022Âπ¥4Êúà‰ª•Êù•È¶ñÊ¨°Ê≤°Êúâ‰∏ãÈôç„ÄÇ</p>
<h2>Ê≥ïÂõΩÊåÅÁª≠ËêéÁº©„ÄÅÂæ∑ÂõΩÈù¢‰∏¥ÊúçÂä°‰∏öÁöÑÂØíÂÜ¨</h2>

<h2>ÂõõÂ§ßÊäÄÊúØÂÖ±ÊåØÔºåËÆ©Â∞èÈπè‰ªéËΩ¶Ëµ∞Âêë‚Äú‰∫∫‚Äù</h2>

<p data-start="497" data-end="514">Â§ßÊë©Áß∞ÔºåËΩ¶‰ºÅ‰∏çÂè™ÊòØÊúâÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåËÄåÊòØÊúâÂ§ßÈáè„ÄÅÂ§öÊ†∑ÂåñÁöÑÁúüÂÆû‰∏ñÁïåÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåËøôËÆ©‰ªñ‰ª¨Âú®ÂèëÂ±ïÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫ÊñπÈù¢ÂÖ∑Â§áÂÖàÂèë‰ºòÂäø„ÄÇ</p>

<p data-start="579" data-end="605"><strong>‰∫å„ÄÅÁîµÊ±†ÊäÄÊúØÔºöÂÜ≥ÂÆöÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫ËÉΩÂä®Â§ö‰πÖ</strong></p>

<p data-start="322" data-end="410">Â§ßÊë©ËÆ§‰∏∫Ôºö‚Äú‰∫∫ÂΩ¢Êú∫Âô®‰∫∫ÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅËÑ±Á¶ªÁîµÊ∫êËá™Áî±Ê¥ªÂä®ÔºåÊúÄÂÖ≥ÈîÆÂ∞±ÊòØÁîµÊ±†ÁöÑËÉΩÈáèÂØÜÂ∫¶ÔºàÂ∞±ÊòØÂ∞è‰ΩìÁßØË£ÖÊõ¥Â§öÁîµÔºâ„ÄÇËÄåËΩ¶‰ºÅÂ∑≤ÁªèÂú®ÁîµÂä®ÂåñÈ¢ÜÂüüÊ∑±ËÄï‰∫ÜÂø´20Âπ¥ÔºåÂÆåÂÖ®ÂÖ∑Â§áËß£ÂÜ≥Ëøô‰∏™ÊäÄÊúØÈöæÈ¢òÁöÑËÉΩÂäõ„ÄÇ‚Äù</p>

Title:  Áà±Â•áËâ∫Â∑≤ÊëòÂà∞‰∫ÜÂæÆÁü≠ÂâßÁöÑÊûúÂÆû

<p style="text-align: justify;">‰Ωú‰∏∫‚ÄúÁà±ËÖæ‰ºòËäí‚Äù‰∏≠ÂîØ‰∏ÄÁã¨Á´ã‰∏äÂ∏ÇÁöÑÈïøËßÜÈ¢ëÂπ≥Âè∞ÔºåÁà±Â•áËâ∫ÔºàNASDAQ:IQÔºâÁöÑ‰∏öÁª©‰∏ÄÂêëÂÖ∑ÊúâË°å‰∏öÈ£éÂêëÊ†áÊÑè‰πâ„ÄÇ</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Âú®ÈïøÁü≠ÂâßÈõÜÊøÄÊàòÔºåÁàÜÊ¨æÂâßÈõÜËØûÁîüÂÖ∑Êúâ‰∏çÁ°ÆÂÆöÊÄßÁöÑËÉåÊôØ‰∏ãÔºåÁà±Â•áËâ∫ËØïÂõæÈÄöËøáÂ§öÁßçÂèòÈù©Êù•ÊèêÂçá‰∏öÁª©Â¢ûÈïøÁöÑÁ°ÆÂÆöÊÄßÔºå‰ªéÊúÄÊñ∞ÁöÑ‰∏öÁª©Ë°®Áé∞Êù•ÁúãÔºåÁà±Â•áËâ∫ÁöÑÊé¢Á¥¢Â∑≤ÂàùËßÅÊàêÊïà„ÄÇ </p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">5Êúà21Êó•ÔºåÁà±Â•áËâ∫ÂèëÂ∏ÉÊà™Ëá≥2025Âπ¥3Êúà31Êó•Êú™ÁªèÂÆ°ËÆ°ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÂ≠£Â∫¶Ë¥¢Êä•„ÄÇË¥¢Êä•ÊòæÁ§∫Ôºå‰∏ÄÂ≠£Â∫¶ÔºåÁà±Â•áËâ∫ÊÄªÊî∂ÂÖ•‰∏∫71.9‰∫øÂÖÉÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂ÂêåÊØî‰ªçÁÑ∂‰∏ãÊªëÁ∫¶9%Ôºå‰ΩÜÁéØÊØîÂ¢ûÈïø‰∫Ü9%ÔºõÊ≠§Â§ñÔºåNon-GAAPÔºàÈùûÁæéÂõΩÈÄöÁî®‰ºöËÆ°ÂáÜÂàôÔºâËøêËê•Âà©Ê∂¶‰∏∫4.6‰∫øÂÖÉÔºåÂêåÊØî‰∏ãÈôç58%ÔºåÁéØÊØîÂ¢ûÈïø13%„ÄÇ </p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">ÂÖ∑‰Ωì‰∏öÂä°Ë°®Áé∞Êù•ÁúãÔºåÁà±Â•áËâ∫ÁöÑÊîØÊü±ÊÄßÊî∂ÂÖ•Êù•Ê∫ê‚Äî‚Äî‰ºöÂëòÊúçÂä°Êî∂ÂÖ•ÊúâÊâÄÂ¢ûÈïøÁéØÊØîÂ¢ûÈïø7%Ëá≥44‰∫øÂÖÉÔºåÂêåÊØî‰∏ãÈôç 8%ÔºõÂú®Á∫øÂπøÂëäÊúçÂä°Êî∂ÂÖ•ÁéØÊØî‰∏ãÈôç7%Ëá≥13.3‰∫øÂÖÉÔºåÂêåÊØî‰∏ãÈôç 10%ÔºõÂÜÖÂÆπÂèëË°åÊî∂ÂÖ•ÁéØÊØîÂ¢ûÈïø53%Ëá≥6.3‰∫øÂÖÉÔºåÂêåÊØî‰∏ãÈôç 32%ÔºõÂÖ∂‰ªñÊî∂ÂÖ•ÁéØÊØîÂ¢ûÈïø23.9%Ëá≥8.3‰∫øÂÖÉÔºåÂêåÊØîÂ¢ûÈïø16%„ÄÇ </p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Áà±Â•áËâ∫ÂàõÂßã‰∫∫„ÄÅÈ¶ñÂ∏≠ÊâßË°åÂÆòÈæöÂÆáÂú®ÂΩìÂ§©Ë¥¢Êä•ÁîµËØù‰ºö‰∏äË°®Á§∫Ôºå‰∏ÄÂ≠£Â∫¶ÂèñÂæóÁöÑ‰∏öÁª©ÁéØÊØîÂ¢ûÈïøÂæóÁõä‰∫éÈïøËßÜÈ¢ëÂÜÖÂÆπÂº∫ÂäøÂõûÂΩíÂíåÂØπÂæÆÂâßÁöÑÊàòÁï•ÊäïÂÖ•„ÄÇ</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Âú®‰ªñÁúãÊù•Ôºå‚ÄúÂ•ΩÂÜÖÂÆπÊ®™Á´ñÈÉΩÁúãÁà±Â•áËâ∫‚ÄùÊ≠£Âú®Âç†È¢ÜÁî®Êà∑ÂøÉÊô∫Ôºå‰∏∫Êú™Êù•ÁöÑÂïÜ‰∏öÂåñÂàõÈÄ†‰∫ÜÊú∫‰ºö„ÄÇËøô‰∫õËøõÂ±ïÂùöÂÆö‰∫ÜÁà±Â•áËâ∫Âü∫‰∫éÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÂíåÁî®Êà∑ÈúÄÊ±ÇÂèòÂåñÔºåÊé®ËøõÂïÜ‰∏öÊ®°ÂºèÂíåÂÜÖÂÆπÁîüÊÄÅËøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•ÂçáÁ∫ßÁöÑ‰ø°ÂøÉ„ÄÇ </p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Ê≠§Â§ñÔºå‰∏çÈöæÂèëÁé∞ÔºåÂú®‰ºöÂëòÊúçÂä°‰ª•ÂèäÂú®Á∫øÂπøÂëäÂ¢ûÈïø‰πèÂäõÁöÑËÉåÊôØ‰∏ãÔºåÁà±Â•áËâ∫Ê≠£ÈÄöËøáÂ§ö‰∏æÊé™Êù•Âº∫ÂåñÂïÜ‰∏öÂåñËÉΩÂäõ„ÄÇ</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Âá∫Êµ∑Â∑≤ÊòØÁà±Â•áËâ∫‰∏ÄÂ§ßÊ†∏ÂøÉÊàòÁï•„ÄÇ‰∏ÄÂ≠£Â∫¶ÔºåÁà±Â•áËâ∫ÂõΩÈôÖÁâàÊî∂ÂÖ•ÂêåÊØîÂ¢ûÈïøË∂Ö30%ÔºåÂπøÂëäÊî∂ÂÖ•ÂêåÊØîÂ¢ûÈïø40%ÔºåÊó•Âùá‰ºöÂëòÊï∞ÂàõÂéÜÂè≤Êñ∞È´ò„ÄÇËøáÂéªÂçäÂπ¥ÔºåÊµ∑Â§ñÊúÄÂèóÊ¨¢ËøéÁöÑÂ§ßÈôÜÂâßÈõÜTop10‰∏≠Áà±Â•áËâ∫Ëá™Âà∂ÂâßÂç†4Â∏≠ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠„ÄäÁà±‰Ω†„ÄãÊî∂ÂÖ•ÂàõÂõΩÈôÖÁâàÁé∞ÂÅ∂Â§ßÈôÜÂâßÈõÜÂéÜÂè≤Êñ∞È´ò„ÄÇ</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">ÂÄºÂæóÂÖ≥Ê≥®ÁöÑÊòØÔºåÂú®ÂéªÂπ¥9Êúà‰∏æÂäûÁöÑ2024Áà±Â•áËâ∫iJOYÁßãÂ≠£ÊÇ¶‰∫´‰ºö‰∏äÔºåÁà±Â•áËâ∫ËøòÂÆ£Â∏É‰∫ÜË¶ÅÊ≠£ÂºèËøõÂÜõÂæÆÁü≠ÂâßÈ¢ÜÂüü„ÄÇ</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">ÊåâÁÖßÁà±Â•áËâ∫ÁöÑËìùÂõæÔºå‚ÄúÂæÆÂâßÂú∫‚ÄùÂ∞Ü‰ª•ÊØèÂë®‰∏§ÈÉ®Êñ∞‰ΩúÁöÑÈÄüÂ∫¶ÔºåËÅöÁÑ¶Áî∑Â•≥È¢ë‰∏éÈì∂ÂèëÊóèÁæ§Ôºå‰∏ªÊâì1‚Äî5ÂàÜÈíüÁöÑÁ´ñÂ±èÂÜÖÂÆπÔºõËÄå‚ÄúÁü≠ÂâßÂú∫‚ÄùÂàôËÆ°ÂàíÊØèÂë®Êõ¥Êñ∞‰∏ÄÈÉ®Êñ∞‰ΩúÔºåÊ∂µÁõñÂè§Ë®Ä„ÄÅÁé∞ÂÅ∂„ÄÅÊÇ¨ÁñëÁ≠âÂ§öÁßçÁ±ªÂûãÔºåÊØèÈõÜÊó∂ÈïøÁ∫¶Âú®5‚Äî20ÂàÜÈíüÔºå‰ª•Ê®™Â±èÂëàÁé∞„ÄÇ</p>

<p><strong>Ê∏ØËÇ°Ôºö</strong>Ê∏ØËÇ°‰ΩéÂºÄ‰ΩéËµ∞ÔºåÊà™Ëá≥Êî∂ÁõòÔºåÊÅíÊåáÊî∂Ë∑å1.19%ÔºåÊÅíÁîüÁßëÊäÄÊåáÊï∞Ë∑å1.7%„ÄÇÂ∞èÈπèÊ±ΩËΩ¶Ê∂®Ë∂Ö5%ÔºåÂÖ¨Âè∏‰∏ÄÂ≠£Â∫¶Ë¥¢Êä•‰∫ÆÁúºÔºåÈ¢ÑËÆ°Á¨¨ÂõõÂ≠£Â∫¶ÂÆûÁé∞ÁõàÂà©ÔºõËÅîÊÉ≥ÈõÜÂõ¢Ë∑åË∂Ö5%ÔºõÂ∞èÁ±≥ÈõÜÂõ¢Ë∑åË∂Ö2%ÔºåÊ≠§ÂâçÈõ∑ÂÜõÂèëÊñáÁß∞YU7È¢ÑËÆ°7ÊúàÊ≠£Âºè‰∏äÂ∏ÇÔºå‰ªäÊôöÈ¢ÑÂèëÂ∏É‰ºöÔºå‰∏ç‰ºöÂÖ¨Â∏ÉÊ≠£Âºè‰ª∑Èí±Ôºå‰πü‰∏ç‰ºöÂºÄÂêØÂ∞èÂÆö„ÄÇ</p>

Title:  ÁæéÈì∂Computex 2025ËßÇÂØüÔºöAIÈúÄÊ±Ç„ÄÅ‰æõÂ∫îÈìæ„ÄÅÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫‰∏éÊäÄÊúØË∑ØÁ∫øÂõæ 
Description:  <p style="text-align: left;">5Êúà19Êó•ÔºåÊú¨Â±äÂè∞ÂåóÂõΩÈôÖÁîµËÑëÂ±ïÔºàComputex 2025ÔºâÊãâÂºÄÂ∏∑ÂπïÔºåÂ∞ÜÊåÅÁª≠Ëá≥23Êó•„ÄÇÊú¨Â±äÂ§ß‰ºö‰ª•‚ÄúAI Next‚Äù‰∏∫‰∏ªËΩ¥ÔºåËÅöÁÑ¶‚ÄúÊô∫ÊÖßËøêÁÆóÔºÜÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫‚Äù‚ÄúÊ¨°‰∏ñ‰ª£ÁßëÊäÄ‚Äù‰ª•Âèä‚ÄúÊú™Êù•ÁßªÂä®‚Äù‰∏âÂ§ß‰∏ªÈ¢ò„ÄÇ</p>
<p style="text-align: left;">ÁõÆÂâç‰∏∫Ê≠¢ÔºåÂ±ï‰ºöÊúâÂì™‰∫õ‰∫ÆÁÇπÔºüÊçÆËøΩÈ£é‰∫§ÊòìÂè∞Ê∂àÊÅØÔºå5Êúà21Êó•ÔºåÁæéÈì∂ÁæéÊûóBrad Lin„ÄÅMike YangÂèëÂ∏ÉÁ†îÊä•ÊåáÂá∫ÔºåComputex 2025Á°ÆËÆ§‰∫ÜÂá†‰∏™Ë∂ãÂäøÔºö<strong>AIÈúÄÊ±ÇÂº∫Âä≤ÔºåAIÁ°¨‰ª∂‰æõÂ∫îÈìæÁì∂È¢àÁºìËß£ÔºåÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫Èù©ÂëΩ‰∏¥Ëøë„ÄÇ</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: left;">Ê†πÊçÆÊä•ÂëäÔºåÂ§ß‰ºö‰∏äÔºåËã±‰ºüËææ„ÄÅËÅîÂèëÁßëÁ≠âÂ∑®Â§¥ÂùáÂ±ïÁ§∫‰∏ã‰∏Ä‰ª£AIËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°àÔºåÊòæÁ§∫AI‰∫ß‰∏öÂ∑≤‰ªéËØïÈ™åËµ∞ÂêëÂ§ßËßÑÊ®°ÈÉ®ÁΩ≤ÔºõÂ§ß‰ºöËøòÊòæÁ§∫Âá∫AIËÆ°ÁÆóÂäõÈúÄÊ±ÇÊøÄÂ¢û„ÄÅ‰æõÂ∫îÈìæÈöúÁ¢çÁºìËß£ÁöÑË∂ãÂäøÔºåÊäïËµÑËÄÖÂÖ≥Ê≥®ÁÇπ‰ªé‰∫ëÁ´ØAIËΩ¨ÂêëÊõ¥ÂπøÊ≥õÁöÑÁâ©ÁêÜAIÂ∫îÁî®ÂíåËæπÁºòËÆ°ÁÆóÈÉ®ÁΩ≤ÔºåÈ¢ÑËÆ°Â∞Ü‰∏∫Âè∞ÁßØÁîµ„ÄÅÁëûÊò±ÂçäÂØº‰Ωì„ÄÅËÅîÂèëÁßëÂíå‰ø°È™ÖÁ≠âÈ´òË¥®ÈáèÂçäÂØº‰ΩìÂÖ¨Âè∏Êèê‰æõÊåÅÁª≠Â¢ûÈïøÂä®Âäõ„ÄÇ</p>

<h2 style="text-align: left;">AIÈúÄÊ±Ç‰ªéËØïÈ™åËΩ¨ÂêëËßÑÊ®°ÈÉ®ÁΩ≤Ôºå‰∫ëÂà∞ËæπÁºòÈõÜÊàêÂä†ÈÄü</h2>
<p style="text-align: left;">Êä•ÂëäÊåáÂá∫ÔºåComputex 2025Â±ï‰ºöÁ°ÆËÆ§ÔºåÂú®Â∏ÇÂú∫ÂØπËµÑÊú¨ÊîØÂá∫Â¢ûÂä†ÁöÑÊãÖÂøßÊó•ÁõäÂ¢ûÂä†‰πãÈôÖÔºåAIÂèëÂ±ïÂäøÂ§¥‰ªç‰øùÊåÅÂº∫Âä≤ÁöÑË∂ãÂäø„ÄÇ</p>

<p style="text-align: left;">Èù¢ÂØπËøô‰∏ÄÊó•Áõä‰∏•Â≥ªÁöÑÂ±ÄÂäøÔºåÂæ∑ÊÑèÂøóÈì∂Ë°åÊòéÁ°ÆË≠¶Âëä‚Äú‰∏∫Êõ¥Â§öÊ≥¢Âä®ÂÅöÂ•ΩÂáÜÂ§á‚Äù„ÄÇ</p>

Title: Trump administration seeks to end basic rights and protections for child immigrants in its custody

Title: Number of US white nationalist groups falls as extremist views go mainstream
Description: <p>Slight drop in hate groups does not signify declining influence, Southern Poverty Law Center report says</p><p>The number of white nationalist, hate and anti-government extremist groups in the US has dropped not because of their declining influence, but because many of their proponents feel their beliefs have become normalized in government and mainstream society, according to a new <a href="https://www.splcenter.org/resources/guides/year-hate-extremism-2024/">report</a> by the Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC).</p><p>The SPLC‚Äôs annual Year in Hate and Extremism report, published on Thursday, said it documented 1,371 hate and extremist groups across the country in 2024, down from 1,430 groups in 2023.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/may/22/white-nationalist-hate-extremist-groups">Continue reading...</a>

Title: Trump defies ethics warnings with private meme coin dinner
Description: <img src="https://images.axios.com/rZf5wc4GtYh7lrqWpEMtLkpqAOI=/2025/05/22/1747953887783.jpg"> <div><a href="https://truthsocial.com/%40realDonaldTrump/114553573338999017" target="_blank">Screenshot via Truth Social</a></div><p>The president hosted a <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/04/23/trump-meme-coin-dinner" target="_blank">highly anticipated</a> "exclusive" dinner for the largest holders of his meme coin, <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/01/19/trump-meme-coin-what-to-know" target="_blank">Official Trump</a>, at his golf club in Virginia on Thursday night.</p><p><strong>Why it matters: </strong>Fight Fight Fight, LLC ‚Äî a company linked to President Trump's family ‚Äî¬†<a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/01/19/donald-trump-crypto-billionaire" target="_blank">sold a digital token</a> that gave anyone in the world a chance to pay for a night of access to the commander-in-chief.</p><hr><ul><li>The promotion has stunned ethics experts. One Democrat <a href="https://x.com/ChrisMurphyCT/status/1919719580080955807" target="_blank">called it</a> "the biggest corruption scandal in the history of the White House."</li><li>White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt denied any conflicts of interest but refused to release the list of attendees, telling reporters: "The president is attending it in his personal time. It is not a White House dinner."</li></ul><p><strong>Between the lines: </strong>Wealthy donors have long used campaign contributions to gain access to elected officials ‚Äî but with key guardrails and oversight.</p><ul><li>U.S. law bars foreign money and prohibits politicians from using campaign funds for personal gain.</li></ul><p><strong>What they're saying: </strong>"We've never had a president actually try to raise money and get people to buy an interest in a venture of his at the same time that he's sitting in the White House," Richard Painter, President George W. Bush's ethics lawyer, <a href="https://www.politico.com/newsletters/morning-money/2025/05/09/the-blunt-reality-of-trumps-brazen-crypto-conflicts-00337504" target="_blank">told Politico</a>.</p><ul><li>Democrats have <a href="https://www.axios.com/newsletters/axios-crypto-fa5b4790-2c4f-11f0-8ce4-89f34dc9bfc1#story1" target="_blank">proposed at least five bills</a> that would block activity like this, but none of them are likely to see action in a GOP-controlled Congress.</li><li>As Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D.-NY) points out, <a href="https://www.semafor.com/article/05/14/2025/senators-tease-passage-of-embattled-crypto-bill-without-language-targeted-at-trump" target="_blank">there are already laws</a> against this kind of thing ‚Äî¬†but <a href="https://www.justsecurity.org/73148/good-governance-paper-no-15-enforcing-the-emoluments-clauses/" target="_blank">enforcement of those rules is murky</a>, especially with Trump loyalists in charge.</li></ul><p><strong>By the numbers: </strong>Inca Digital, a data intelligence firm, estimates that the top 220 holders <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-meme-coin-top-220-buyers-spent-140-million-analysis/" target="_blank">collectively spent more than $140 million</a> to ensure they got a spot in the meme coin celebration.</p><ul><li>The most spent was $16.4 million.</li><li>The contest was announced on April 23 and ran through May 12. To qualify to attend, a wallet owner had to register with Fight Fight Fight, pass a background check, and hold a high enough <em>average</em> amount of Official Trump over the contest period. </li><li>The token had lost considerable value since <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/01/18/trump-meme-coin-25-billion" target="_blank">its pre-inauguration release</a>, but it's up more than 50% since the dinner was announced.</li></ul><p><strong>State of play: </strong>That price increase has held even after the contest ended, suggesting that holders might expect more perks or access ahead. </p><p><strong>The intrigue: </strong>Only a few attendees were known ahead of time. Crypto billionaire <a href="https://x.com/justinsuntron/status/1925225722559242748" target="_blank">Justin Sun</a>, who at one point was under investigation by the SEC, is probably the best known. </p><ul><li>Kain Warwick, an Australian crypto investor and creator of the decentralized finance platform, Synthetix, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2025/05/12/us/politics/trump-crypto-coin-auction.html" target="_blank">told the New York Times</a> that he had a spot. </li><li>So did the meme coin startup MemeCore, which acquired a massive stockpile in order to send someone to the event.</li></ul><p><strong>How it works: </strong>Other buyers haven't been publicizing their attendance, but blockchain analysis suggested that much of the buying was happening outside the U.S., according to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2025-trump-memecoin-foreign-crypto-traders/?srnd=homepage-americas" target="_blank">an analysis by Bloomberg</a>.</p><p><strong>What we're watching: </strong>Fight Fight Fight still controls <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/04/14/trump-meme-coin-40-million" target="_blank">80% of the supply</a> of Official Trump, which it can sell off over time. </p>

Title: Supreme Court says Trump can fire agency heads for now, but insulates Fed
Description: <p>The Supreme Court issued a stay Thursday allowing President Trump's removal of two independent agency heads to remain in force for now ‚Äî but suggested <a href="https://www.axios.com/economy/federal-reserve" target="_blank">Federal Reserve</a> officials have special protection based on the central bank's unique structure.</p><p><strong>Why it matters: </strong>The ruling suggests that the court will ultimately vest the president with significant authority to remove the heads of agencies, even when Congress has structured them to be insulated from politics. </p><hr><ul><li>But the decision's carve-out for the Fed will come as a significant relief to markets that were concerned about the central bank's independence.</li></ul><p><strong>Catch up quick: </strong>The court issued a stay Thursday night in a case involving Trump's move to fire members of the National Labor Relations Board and Merit Systems Protection Board.</p><ul><li>"The stay reflects our judgment that the Government is likely to show that both the NLRB and MSPB exercise considerable executive power," and that therefore it is within the executive authority of the president to remove them, the court's majority wrote.</li><li>But is is not a final decision. The question of whether the NLRB and MSPB appointments fall under certain exceptions "is better left for resolution after full briefing and argument."</li><li>The order was unsigned, and the three liberal justices dissented, arguing that a stay should be granted.</li></ul><p><strong>The intrigue: </strong>In issuing the stay, the majority noted a claim by the fired members that their case could have implications for the president's ability to remove members of the Fed's Board of Governors or Open Market Committee.</p><p><strong>What they're saying: "</strong>We disagree. The Federal Reserve is a uniquely structured, quasi-private entity that follows in the distinct historical tradition of the First and Second Banks of the United States," the majority wrote.</p><p><strong>Yes, but: </strong>A dissent by Justice Elena Kagan seemed impatient with the logic of the Fed carve-out. </p><ul><li>"The majority closes today's order by stating, out of the blue, that it has no bearing on" removal of Fed officials.</li><li>"I am glad to hear it," Kagan writes, "and do not doubt the majority's intention to avoid imperiling the Fed."</li><li>"But then, today's order poses a puzzle. For the Federal Reserve's independence rests on the same constitutional and analytic foundations as that of the NLRB, MSPB, FTC, FCC, and so on‚Äîwhich is to say it rests largely on" Humphrey's Executor, a 1935 case establishing the constitutionality of independent agencies.</li></ul><p><strong>Between the lines: </strong>From the moment Trump started removing agency commissioners earlier this year, analysts predicted the ultimate target might be more control over the Fed.</p><ul><li>But some hoped past court <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/02/21/fed-trump-independent-agencies" target="_blank">comments</a> about the central bank as a unique entity might insulate it from such action. </li></ul><p><em>Editor's note: This story has been updated with new details throughout. </em></p>

Title: Man charged with murder in shooting of Israeli Embassy employees
Description: <p>A man was charged with two counts of first-degree murder on Thursday in relation to the <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/22/israeli-embassy-staff-killed-shooting-capital-jewish-museum-dc" target="_blank">fatal shooting</a> of <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/22/dc-israeli-embassy-shooting-victims" target="_blank">two people</a> outside the Capital Jewish Museum in Washington, D.C., according to a <a href="https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25951885-govuscourtsdcd28088110/" target="_blank">criminal complaint</a>.</p><p><strong>The big picture: </strong>Elias Rodriguez of Chicago is also facing federal charges that include murder of foreign officials, causing the death of a person through the use of a firearm, and discharge of a firearm during a crime.</p><hr><p><strong>Driving the news: </strong>The killings of Yaron Lischinsky and Sarah Lynn Milgrim are being investigated as a hate crime and a crime of terrorism, Jeanine Pirro, interim U.S. attorney in Washington, said during a press conference Thursday.</p><ul><li> Pirro called it "a death penalty-eligible case" but said it's "far too early" to determine whether prosecutors will pursue it.</li><li>Authorities are executing search warrants for Rodriguez' electronic devices, reviewing his social media accounts and all of his internet postings, FBI officials said during the briefing.</li></ul><p><strong>Zoom in: </strong>Rodriguez allegedly told an officer at the scene of the shooting that he "did it" and that he was unarmed, according to <a href="https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25951899-59a2fd4c/" target="_blank">an affidavit</a> from an FBI agent.</p><ul><li>The affidavit states that the suspect was captured on security video firing a weapon several times at the two victims before getting closer and "firing several more times.<strong>"</strong></li><li>One of the victims attempted to crawl away but the suspect followed behind her and fired again, per the affidavit.</li><li>A 9-millimeter handgun was recovered from the scene, the affidavit says.</li></ul><p><strong>Context:</strong> Rodriguez was arrested Wednesday after being apprehended by a museum security guard minutes after the shooting. </p><ul><li>He is believed to have acted alone, police said.</li></ul><p><em>Editor's note: This is a breaking news story. Please check back for updates.</em></p>

Title: House GOP demands Biden's doctor, advisers testify on his health
Description: <p>The Republican-led House Oversight Committee on Thursday took its first step in its new investigation of the White House's handling of <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/20/biden-cancer-sympathy-suspicion" target="_blank">former President Biden's health</a>: Demanding testimony from his doctor and his top advisors.</p><p><strong>Why it matters: </strong>The probe comes amid a renewed focus on Biden's age and fitness for office after his <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/21/biden-cancer-diagnosis-timing" target="_blank">cancer diagnosis</a> and the release of "<a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/21/biden-town-hall-event-new-book-original-sin" target="_blank">Original Sin</a>," a new book by Alex Thompson and Jake Tapper.</p><hr><ul><li>Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wisc.) said Wednesday he will launch a parallel investigation into Biden's health, <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/21/senate-republican-ron-johnson-biden-health" target="_blank">Axios' Stef Kight first reported</a>.</li></ul><p><strong>Driving the news: </strong>House Oversight Committee chair James Comer (R-Ky.) sent letters to Biden's personal physician, Kevin O'Connor, and former White House officials Neera Tanden, Anthony Bernal, Annie Tomasini and Ashley Williams seeking testimony.</p><ul><li>In the <a href="https://oversight.house.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/05-22-2025-Letter-to-Dr.-OConnor.pdf" target="_blank">letter to O'Connor</a>, Comer cited his February 2024 assessment that Biden was "robust" and "fit to successfully execute the duties of the Presidency," as well as <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/16/biden-hur-tape-special-counsel-audio" target="_blank">Axios</a> <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/14/book-biden-cabinet-crisis-access" target="_blank">reporting</a> about Biden's cognitive struggles.</li><li>"The Committee seeks information to ensure accurate information was provided to the American people and your health reports were not subject to any improper influence," Comer wrote.</li><li>In <a href="https://oversight.house.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/05-22-2025-Letter-to-Tanden.pdf" target="_blank">letters to aides</a>, Comer questioned "who made key decisions and exercised the powers of the executive branch during the Biden Administration."</li></ul><p><strong>Between the lines: </strong>Republicans have tried to make Biden's age a fruitful area of inquiry since 2023, but they see the flurry of events around Biden in recent weeks as providing a new opening.</p><ul><li>Comer previously sought testimony from Bernal, Tomasini and Williams in October 2023, though his requests to O'Connor and Tanden, the former director of Biden's Domestic Policy Council, are new. </li><li>Comer also fought for the release of the audio of Special Counsel Robert Hur's interview with Biden after the publication of his report last year.</li></ul><p><strong>What to watch: </strong>Comer said he is seeking responses by May 29 and testimony scheduled between June 2 and 25.</p><ul><li>A spokesperson for Biden declined to comment.</li></ul><p><em>Editor's note: This story has been updated with additional reporting. </em></p>

Title: Trump admin nixes Harvard's ability to enroll international students
Description: <p>The <a href="https://www.axios.com/politics-policy/donald-trump" target="_blank">Trump</a> administration pulled <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/06/harvard-trump-grant-funding" target="_blank">Harvard University's</a> ability to enroll international students, the Department of Homeland Security <a href="https://www.dhs.gov/news/2025/05/22/harvard-university-loses-student-and-exchange-visitor-program-certification-pro%20" target="_blank">announced</a> Thursday.</p><p><strong>The big picture: </strong>Harvard<strong> </strong>has been at <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/13/trump-revokes-funding-harvard" target="_blank">the center</a> of the administration's war on universities over alleged antisemitism on campus and diversity, equity and inclusion practices.</p><hr><p><strong>Driving the news: </strong>Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem ordered DHS to terminate Harvard's student and exchange visitor program certification, the agency said. </p><ul><li>"This means Harvard can no longer enroll foreign students and existing foreign students must transfer or lose their legal status," per DHS.</li><li>Noem said the administration is "holding Harvard accountable for fostering violence, antisemitism, and coordinating with the Chinese Communist Party on its campus."</li><li>She said in a statement that the university lost their program certification "as a result of the failure to adhere to the law," calling it "a warning to all universities and academic institutions across the country."</li></ul><p><strong>What they're saying: </strong>Harvard spokesperson Jason Newton called the government's action unlawful. </p><ul><li>"We are fully committed to maintaining Harvard's ability to host international students and scholars, who hail from more than 140 countries and enrich the University ‚Äì and this nation ‚Äì immeasurably," he said in an emailed statement.  </li><li>He said the university is working quickly to provide guidance to the campus community. </li><li>"This retaliatory action threatens serious harm to the Harvard community and our country, and undermines Harvard's academic and research mission," Newton said.</li></ul><p><strong>Context: </strong>The administration has for months been discussing plans to try to block certain colleges from having any foreign students if it decides too many are "pro-Hamas," <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/03/27/trump-palestinian-hamas-purge-colleges-protests" target="_blank">Axios reported</a>.</p><ul><li>The idea of prohibiting colleges from enrolling any student visa-holders grew out of Secretary of State Marco Rubio's "<a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/03/06/state-department-ai-revoke-foreign-student-visas-hamas" target="_self">Catch and Revoke</a>" program, which now is focusing on students who protested against the war in Gaza.</li></ul><p><em>Editor's note: This is a breaking news story. Please check back for updates.</em></p><p><strong>More from Axios:</strong></p><ul><li><a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/03/27/trump-palestinian-hamas-purge-colleges-protests" target="_blank">Exclusive: Trump's "pro-Hamas" purge could block foreign students from colleges</a></li><li><a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/13/trump-revokes-funding-harvard" target="_blank">Trump admin cancels additional grants to Harvard</a></li><li><a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/06/harvard-trump-grant-funding" target="_blank">Trump admin to halt new grant funding to Harvard</a></li></ul>

Title: What to know about the Israeli Embassy employees killed in D.C.
Description: <p>Yaron Lischinsky and Sarah Lynn Milgrim were identified Thursday as the two people killed <a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/22/israeli-embassy-staff-killed-shooting-capital-jewish-museum-dc" target="_blank">in a shooting</a> Wednesday night outside the Capital Jewish Museum in Washington, D.C.</p><p><strong>The big picture: </strong>The suspect, who authorities believe acted alone, was arrested by a museum security guard after he entered the building following the shooting. FBI Deputy Director<strong> </strong>Dan Bongino called the shooting an "act of targeted violence" in a <a href="https://x.com/FBIDDBongino/status/1925420904500085116" target="_blank">post to X.</a></p><hr><ul><li>The Metropolitan Police Department identified the suspect as Elias Rodriguez, 30, of Chicago.</li><li>Metropolitan Police Chief Pamela Smith said in a press briefing that Rodriguez chanted "free, free Palestine" while being arrested.</li></ul><p><strong>State of play: </strong>Lischinsky, 30, and Milgrim, 26, both worked for the Israeli Embassy, the Israel Foreign Ministry said in a statement <a href="https://x.com/IsraelMFA/status/1925459648028545364" target="_blank">shared to X</a>.</p><ul><li>The pair met while working at the Embassy and were soon to be engaged, Israeli Ambassador to Washington Yechiel Leiter said at a press briefing.</li><li>Lischinsky and Milgrim were set to travel to Israel on Sunday, Milgrim's father, Robert Milgrim, told the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2025/05/22/world/middleeast/israel-embassy-dc-shooting-victims-sarah-milgrim-yaron-lischinsky.html" target="_blank">New York Times</a>. While there, she was going to meet his family for the first time and Lischinsky had planned to propose, he said.</li></ul><p><em>Here's what we know about the victims so far:</em></p><h2>Yaron Lischinsky</h2><p><strong>Lischinsky was a research</strong> assistant at the Israeli Embassy in D.C. since September 2022, according to his <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaron-lischinsky/" target="_blank">LinkedIn</a>. </p><ul><li>He was previously a desk officer at the Population and Immigration Authority in Jerusalem. </li></ul><p><strong>Lischinsky received</strong> a Bachelor's degree from the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, where he studied international relations and Asian affairs. </p><ul><li>He also received a Master's degree in government, diplomacy and strategy from Reichman University with a focus on diplomacy and conflict studies. </li></ul><p><strong>Zoom out: </strong>Originally from Germany, Lischinsky moved to Israel at 16, per the New York Times.</p><ul><li>The German Embassy did not immediately respond to Axios' request for comment. Germany's Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul told reporters Lischinsky was an Israeli diplomat and held German citizenship. </li><li>He grew up with a Jewish father and a Christian mother and was a practicing Christian, the New York Times reported.</li></ul><p><strong>Ron Prosor, </strong>Israel's ambassador to Germany, called Lischinsky "bright, curious, engaged" in a <a href="https://x.com/Ron_Prosor/status/1925484186023895257" target="_blank">post to X</a>. </p><ul><li>Prosor said he had taught Lischinsky when he was a student at Reichman University and also worked with him as a diplomat. </li><li>"He was a Christian, a true lover of Israel, served in the IDF, and chose to dedicate his life to the State of Israel and the Zionist cause," Prosor wrote.</li></ul><p><strong>Nissim Otmazgin,</strong> the Dean of Humanities at Hebrew University, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/us/live-news/israeli-embassy-washington-dc-shooting-05-21-25#cmazf9tfe000q3b6m30j28rl2#cmazf9tfe000q3b6m30j28rl2#cmazf9tfe000q3b6m30j28rl2" target="_blank">told CNN</a> that Lischinsky's "dream was to become a diplomat." </p><ul><li>"In many ways, I think for me, he symbolizes the hope of Israel," Otmazgin said, adding that he was "idealistic" and "trying to do good for their country."</li><li>"So in this sense, it is not only a personal tragedy, it's also kind of public tragedy," he said.</li></ul><h2>Sarah Lynn Milgrim</h2><p><strong>Milgrim had been working</strong> at the embassy since November 2023 in its Department of Public Diplomacy, according to her <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/sarah-milgrim/" target="_blank">LinkedIn</a>. </p><ul><li>She previously worked at Tech2Peace in Tel Aviv, where she focused on "the role of friendships in the Israeli-Palestinian peacebuilding process," per LinkedIn. </li><li>She obtained a Bachelor's degree in environmental studies from the University of Kansas. Her LinkedIn also showed two Master's degrees ‚Äî one from the University for Peace and the other from American University. </li></ul><p><strong>KU Hillel,</strong> a Jewish student group at Kansas University, said <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/DJ9SZpAK8Ha/?hl=en" target="_blank">in a statement </a>that Milgrim's "bright spirit and passion for the Jewish community touched everyone fortunate enough to know her." </p><ul><li>"Those closest to her describe her as 'the definition of the best person," the statement continued.</li></ul><p><strong>Zoom in: </strong>Her father said he saw news alerts for the shooting Wednesday night and<strong> </strong>his wife checked their daughter's location, only to see it at the crime scene. </p><ul><li>"I pretty much already knew," he told the New York Times. "I was hoping to be wrong."</li></ul><p><strong>Go deeper: </strong><a href="https://www.axios.com/2025/05/22/israeli-embassy-staff-killed-shooting-capital-jewish-museum-dc" target="_blank">2 Israeli Embassy staff killed near Capital Jewish Museum in D.C., officials say</a></p><p><em>Editor's note: This story has been updated with additional information.</em></p>

Title: Hurricane season expected to be above normal, NOAA says
Description: <p>The <a href="https://www.axios.com/local/new-orleans/2025/05/09/fema-chief-fired-cameron-hamilton-louisiana" target="_blank">2025 Atlantic hurricane season</a> is expected to be above
